Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in August, 2011. I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. Forgive me if I ramble... Location. It is about 3 blocks from the Southernmost Point/Hotel on Duval Street. It is definitely on the quieter end of street. If you don't mind a little more walking, this is awesome. Don't be fooled though, there is still lots to eat and lots to do on this end, we just found that more of the attractions/bars were on the other end though. Hotel. The hotel itself was awesome. The pictures on their website look exactly like what it looks like in person. It is very quaint and everyone is so friendly. Check in and check out was a breeze. The pool area and hot tub area were awesome. Again, pictures don't like in this case and this really looked like something out of a movie to the point where I feel like the price is really low for the hotel. Bar. The fact that you get a free drink ticket for each registered person per night is awesome in itself. It used to be that you could only use it during happy hour, but they changed it where you can go whenever the bar is open. We found this to be so much fun! Betty the bartender is AWESOME! We found it was a lot of fun to socialize with others who were staying at the hotel and to learn where everyone was from and talk. It was just so much fun. Breakfast. Despite it being a small hotel, this was probably one of the best continental breakfasts ever. They had bagels, cereal, muffins, juice, fresh fruit cups and parfaits, pasteries and the best part - a tray to take it back to your cozy bed and eat breakfast in bed! Perfect! Rooms. Speaking of cozy beds, the rooms were unbelievable. A huge t.v. (which my husband was particularly happy about when we were in the room), super comfy bed, modern and trendy decor, the bathroom was really upscale and nice as well. Again, I feel like the bang for your buck here is huge. I don't know why the prices were so cheap, but I felt like they could have gotten a lot more per night. Most rooms also overlooked the pool which was a nice way to wake up. I feel like I keep using the same word over: "perfect", but it really was. It was so quaint that you knew others who were staying at the hotel. You would talk about what everyone was doing for the day. The employees were just as nice if not nicer. They make you feel like a long lost friend and make you feel so at home. Really, don't hesitate if you are looking for an amazing hotel in Key West. You will not at all be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Is An Insufficient Adjective For This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeedABiggerPassport
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchid Key over Labor Day weekend with my wife and a friend while we were in Key West for a wedding. It. was. awesome. Having been on a cruise the week before, my standards were higher than usual, but Kim, Sean, and Brandon did a fantastic job making sure our stay was pleasant (yes, the service was really that good). Don't let the exterior of the property fool you; the rooms are *extremely* nice, the pool was clean/kept, and lets not forget the happy hour everyday at the on-site bar. Our bed was *very* comfortable, and the bathroom was luxurious. (I slept better on it then I do on my bed at home). I'm looking forward to returning to Key West, and I'll be staying at the Orchid Key when I do.

Reviews.Title: “great and we will return”
Reviews.Author: dljcoj
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel right in the middle of Key West eating/drinking/site seeing. Rooms are great and great looking. The bar is small but great to relax and for small talk with other guests and a talkative bartender who also knows where to eat and what to see. You can park your car and walk to all activites.

Reviews.Title: “Best Key West Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TropicJim
Reviews.Content: Me and my long time companion have been visiting the Orchid Key Inn since 2000. We have always had such a lovely time and are always treated well. We just returned from out annual trip in late August. As usual Brandon is always right on top of things & always makes our stay so comfortable. Thanks Brandonâ€”we can always count on you. This year we were able to meet Kim as well. Unfortunate for me I had injured my leg prior to our trip & needed a wheel chair, she took care of that immediately & made sure our stay was wonderful as well. Hats off to Brandon and Kim, they are a great asset to your lovely Inn. Looking forward to our trip next year minus the wheelchair. Last but not least the bartenders & breakfast help were all great as well. Kudos to Andrew for offering me his crutches. Thanks Again, Donna Tutten & Jim Midzalkowski

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: elmeyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Key Inn for 5 nights celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. Everything about the Inn was perfect. We arrived 2 hours before check in time and our Jr. Spa Suite was all ready for us. Kim at the front desk greeted us with a smile and made several recommendations for places to visit and marked them on a map for us. Our room was spotlessly clean and we enjoyed breakfast each morning by the pool and happy hour each evening at the Orchid Bar. Andrew, the bartender, was so nice to us and gave us excellent recommendations for dinner spots. Our room was poolside however we were never bothered by any noise and slept wonderfully in the comfortable king size bed. We can't wait to go back to Key West and will most definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest experience in a hotel..we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Cmt1211
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews but my husband and I feel that this hotel did an amazing job! We stayed here for 3 nights and wish we could've stayed longer. We loved our room and everything included in it. The hotel receptionist, Kim was super helpful in making sure we enjoyed our stay not only in the hotel, but in Key West! She gave us ideas on things we can do and even made reservations for us. All we had to do was sit back and relax. The hotel also gives you a complimentary drink daily for each person, and we loved going to the bar. Though the variety of drinks were awesome, we couldn't help but chat with Betty, the bartender who was such a pleasure to chat with. Every staff that we encountered in this hotel was awesome! Thank you so much for a wonderful experience. You guys definitely made a great first impression of Key West. We will be back to see you guys again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel - highly recommended and we'll definitely use it again!”
Reviews.Author: Fishers240711
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to the UK from our family holiday here and although we've visited Florid on quite a few occasions now, it was our first trip to the Keys and Key West. We chose the Orchid Key Inn purely on the reviews from Trip Advisor and so glad we did. The hotel was ideally situated on the quieter end of Duval Street and was in a perfect position to only be a 10 to 15 minute walk from everything you could ever need, beautiful beaches, all points of interest, restaurants, shops, marina, mallory square, southern most point etc so it was a case of leave the car and just enjoy the stroll!!! The rooms and hotel were kept immaculate, the staff were just fantastic- nothing too much trouble and were relentless in trying to ensure everything was as you asked for, what more could you ask? The breakfast was lovely, fresh and with a great selection to choose from - to eat it by the pool & jacuzzi in the morning added that extra little bit of sweetness! This hotel has to be one of the most friendly, comfortable and clean hotels we've ever had the pleasure of staying in. We can only describe it as "one of the best kept secrets in Key West", it's an absolute jewel. So we all say thank you so much to everyone at the Orchid Key Inn and we will most definitely be back!! The Fishers

Reviews.Title: “Hotel did not disappoint - within walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: SandandSea526
Reviews.Content: So glad we chose this hotel. It really was as nice as the other reviewers said it was. Brendan at the front desk was unique. Rooms were modern & clean. The smell was nice but a little overpowering. It was great to walk out your door and in 10 feet be in the pool. Thought it might be noisy at night, but we had no problem sleeping. If we make the trip to Key West again, we'll definitely stay here. (It so reminded me of the hotels from the 60's, but updated!)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Guest Service EVER!”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travel247
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night, and I wish it could have been longer! First of all, the front desk manager (Shawn, who was absolutely amazing!) checked us in 3 hours early! Our room was a little short on space, but it did not bother us one bit when we saw the quality of the room. The decor, furniture, and bathroom were TOP QUALITY. It felt like we were staying in a swanky spa. I even ran around taking pictures of the tile work in the bathroom, because I want to use the same design in my own home. The TV was a huge flat screen and the bed was super comfortable! The Orchid Bar was a chic place to have drinks before we went out for dinner (we got two free drink tickets when we checked in). In fact, we loved that little bar so much, we came back to it after getting bored of the Duval St. scene. The great thing about the hotel's location is that it is on Duval, but it is not in the middle of the noisy section of the street. It is quiet and relatively close to the southernmost point. I cannot say enough great things about the employees at this hotel. Like I mentioned, Shawn at the front desk was extremely helpful and accommodating. Also, we loved the bartender at the Orchid Bar! What impressed us the most was that when we got home from our trip, we could not find one of our ipods. Only four days after we got home and realized that it was missing, we got a package from FedEx. The hotel sent us the ipod we had left in our room. I could not believe the amazing guest service that this hotel delivered! If guest service is important to you, this is the place to go! If we ever venture back to Key West, I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families with older teens”
Reviews.Author: Kolomya
Reviews.Content: Even in the low season, Key West is not a bargain if you need a suite. Orchid Key Inn is not inexpensive, but it does provide reasonably good value for its lovely two-room suites. It lived up to our high cleanliness standards, and the service was great. Its location is good: right on the quieter part of Duvall, off Truman Ave. A nice continental breakfast is served at the pool. They charge for parking, but they don't milk you. Kudos to Brandon and the rest of the front desk crew for superior service.

Reviews.Title: “Central location yet offers peace and quiet amid the action and a lot more”
Reviews.Author: ExeterHilary
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Well situated half way down Duvall Street. So you can walk both ways and see Key West on foot. Very well appointed room. Just about everything you need on the checklist including; quiet lovely pool, free drinks, lovely products, magnifying mirror, fluffy towels, etc etc. High spec decor in room so we felt quite pampered. Breakfast is very good, the best one on the trip when so many in hotels in the USA are cellophane wrapped muffins with a sell by date going on into 2015!!! Friendly staff who bring drinks to you as you lounge by the pool. It's a tough life! The only issue was that our room was close to the road so a bit of traffic noise--not really a big deal

Reviews.Title: “Perfect size and location!”
Reviews.Author: RocNancy
Reviews.Content: We loved the Orchid Key! From our first impression through check out everything flowed just as it should. The front desk was manned by knowledgeable and helpful employees. The room was the ideal size, well appointed, and a quite comfortable modern design .Bar, pool and hot tub were laid out well in a small area, making them comfortable and attractive enough to make one want to linger. But just outside the surprisingly quiet surroundings Key West and all its glitter beckons. The location is central to everything and the concierge has considerably added to all your notes on what to do so off you go! Very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: SLB005
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. We were on our 10th anniversary trip, and had booked this hotel in advance based on reviews online - we are so glad we did! The hotel is very small, so it gives it a more personal, homey feel. The room was perfect - very clean, comfortable, with flat screen TV, microwave, fridge, safe, nice bathroom with lots of soft and fluffy towels! There is a wonderful breakfast each morning poolside, with free newspapers. All of the staff here is amazing! The evening concierge, Brandon, is excellent. He gave us many great tips about where to eat, where to go, what to see. He had lots of great stories about the island and the history. Very professional and acommodating. There is a small bar at the hotel, and Mike, the bartender, is also great! He is very personable and funny. Since the hotel is on Duval Street, it is close to anything you would want to do, within walking distance. We had a great time in Key West, and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Orchid Key Inn is a Diamond”
Reviews.Author: jbhlaw
Reviews.Content: I just recently took a trip to Key West. I found the Orchid Key Inn on the internet and booked a room there. Since the Inn is actually on Duval Street, I did not expect much except loud and dirty. I was tremendously wrong, and my room was right on Duval. Upon arrival, I met Brandon at the front desk. I told him of some issues I was having with the trip. He was exceptionally accommodating. His advice on attractions and restaurants was dead on. He was to be off at 10 p.m., but stayed with us until we had everyting we needed. The next morning, I went to the front desk again and met Kim. I told her that I was having a problem with a fishing reservation and felt I was getting jerked around. Within twenty minutes, she had my reservations cancelled and booked me with a different charter company, who will also get a very positive review. She even worked to get my deposit back. A trip that was heading for disaster turned out great, and I have the staff at Orchid Key to thank. The facilities are plush, clean and very modern, even for a hotel with a neon sign. The retro look works for them. It is obvious the owner spent a good deal of money to make the place as nice as it is. The pool area is small but beautiful. The bar area is also small, but the staff there are awesome as well. My Wife and I enjoyed a couple quiet evenings by the pool - and did not get bothered by the noise of Duval only a few feet away. So the facility is a way to have it all: You are right in the middle of every thing and yet still have a perfect getaway spot. For the price, it is hard to imagine beating the Orchid Key Inn for value and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing. Would highly reccomend!”
Reviews.Author: stephandbobby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at the Orchid Key Inn strictly based off of TripAdvisor reviews, and we were so happy we decided to stay there. The location is perfect - just steps from the chaos of Duval Street but it's protected from all of the noise in a unique little "eden-esque" hideaway. Our room was amazing. Other reviews said the rooms were very small. It was perfect size for us and was immaculately clean, perfectly decorated and the attention to detail during rennovations didn't go unnoticed. We stayed in 115 which was right by the pool. The rooms have a mini fridge, a microwave, bath robes, a hair dryer and iron. My husband and I agree that we got some of the best sleep we've ever had in that bed. The drapes they use make the room completely dark, so it's almost like you lose track of time like you would on a cruise ship. Brandon provided us 6 drink tickets upon arrival, which can be used for any domestic beer or house wine during your stay when the bar is open. During the day lounging at the pool, the female front desk person brought us all ice water, which was definitely nice and unexpected. On another day, the bartender brought around samples of a frozen banana cocktail. You can't get service like that anywhere else! We would compare this place to definitely more of the high-end places we've stayed at before and paid double for, including the W Hotel in Atlanta and the Contemporary Resort at Disney World. Breakfast was also a nice touch, and included hard boiled eggs, assorted pastries, french toast, fruit, granola and yogurt cups, cereals and juice. At the pool, someone was always clearing away used towels and bringing out fresh ones. The Orchid Key by far exceeded our expectations and we were sad to leave! Traveling tip: if you have a bicycle, they do have a bike rack directly across from the check-in area. We saved a bunch of money bringing our bikes with us so we just rode around everywhere and never had to pay for parking outside of the hotel! Thanks Orchid Key for everything!!

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful little gem right on Duval!”
Reviews.Author: iheartkeylargo
Reviews.Content: I see why this hotel is number one rated on TripAdvisor. It is absolutely beautiful and staff was wonderful. It appeared newly renovated with modern tiled bathroom and new furniture. It had a very soothing, spa-like feel. We had a smaller room and bathroom had only a shower, but it was lovely and shower was big enough for two. :) The air conditioning worked really well, as I like the room COLD! Room and grounds were immaculately kept. I noticed that we never saw housekeepers or housekeeping carts, almost like "magic." Also very quiet with bubbling fountains outside the room to drown out any noise from Duval. I completely forgot we were right on the main street. Pool area was lovely, as was the bar, and the complimentary drinks/cheese and crackers were appreciated. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Fennellini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 2 day Miami and 4 day Key West vacation and the Orchid Key Inn was definitely a highlight of the trip. Despite being on Duvall Street (the quieter end), the street and pedestrian traffic noise was minimal to non-existent. The fountains around the property provided a peaceful and tranquil environment to recharge. The room was clean, the bathroom was spa-like, and the bed was extremely comfortable. There was also an in-room (empty) fridge, so we were able to buy our own water and snacks for the trip. The continental breakfast was good; lots of protein and fruit options. Happy hour each night was a must with great drink prices and snacks! The hotel was within walking or biking distance to most anything in Key West. In fact, the only time we used our car was to drive to Stock Island to eat at Hogfish Bar and Grill (absolutely loved). Other places we ate and would recommend: Latitudes (have to take a free ferry to Sunset Key, but the atmosphere is unbeatable), BOâ€™s Fish Wagon (I had the fried conch sandwich and it was amazing, hubby had the fish sandwich-it was good; loved the atmosphere), Cuban Coffee Queen (so good, but wished we would have split a Cuban Queen Mix, since we had to try the beans and rice), Nine One Five (ordered quite a few of the small plates and a Â½ price bottle of bubbly--had a great meal). Overall, our trip to Key West was exceptional and the Orchid Key Inn was a huge part. Brandon at the front desk was great, friendly and full of recommendations. All the staff at the hotel treated you like a family member rather than just a guest. We would definitely return to the Orchid Key Inn !

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have asked for a nicer place to hide away.”
Reviews.Author: ChardonnayandMerlot
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on this retro boutique hotel. Quiet location. Staff, especially Brandon and Kim, were extremely helpful and accommodating. Excellent dinner recommendations. The room was lovely and efficient. Bedding so comfortable. Hotel bar fabulous/great place to end the evenings in Key West. Would highly recommend and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: parkerobie
Reviews.Content: The Orchid Key was a great find and a great value. We love the smaller boutique type hotels, and this did not disappoint. It was cozy and without being too trendy, and was just right for the bargain finder. Wonderful continental breakfast really "hit the spot". There is also a happy hour at the Orchid bar from 5-7 that offers complimentary beer and house wine, and half off well drinks. I did have a little issue with the bartender and the non-well drinks we ordered, but didn't push it. Although our room was wonderful, it had a horrible, lingering odor that permeated all our clothes and our bags. Not sure what the smell was..... One more negative are the poolside lounge chairs. Although very pretty, they were not condusive to laying on comfortably. Terribly annoying. It was impossible to lay on your stomach and try to get some sun on your back! I will say the staff was wonderful though, and the location on Duvall St. is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for in Key West”
Reviews.Author: weathergirl29
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend in Key West for my birthday. I wanted a unique place to stay that was new, clean, comfortable, and located on Duval. Orchid Key Inn scored high on all points, so we booked a standard king room. Check in was great, we were there early so the front desk let us leave our luggage while we went to grab lunch. By the time we got back the room was ready. We were in a room just off the pool (it's a motel-style layout) and the room was new, fresh, clean and even better...freezing cold! It was so crazy hot and humid the whole weekend that a good air conditioner was a necessity, and the one in our room worked perfectly. We even snuggled up in the down comforter on the bed! Pool: Great for cooling off. We ended up staying by the pool more than we had planned (again it was just too hot) but the chairs are comfy, I loved being just steps away from my room, and since the hotel seems to cater more toward adults than kids, it was relaxing. One afternoon they even brought everyone fresh fruit smoothies to enjoy by the pool! We also liked the fact that it was open 24hrs. Maybe we were just lucky, but no one was ever in the pool at night, so we had the area to ourselves. That became our ritual: go eat a nice meal, then come back and take a leisurely night swim before drifting off to sleep. We never heard anyone at night, so pool noise was not an issue (and we were maybe 5 feet from the pool.) Again, maybe we were just lucky but all the guests were very nice and respectful of others. Orchid Bar: the bar is very cool and since they give you 2 free drink coupons a day (for beer or wine), we used them for beers by the pool. They also put out little snacks during cocktail hour (veggies, ranch dip, cheese cubes and crackers) and that was nice to enjoy by the pool. The free continental breakfast was just perfect for us, and negated the need for us to get out early and look for breakfast. They had fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, English muffins, bagels, toast, waffles and fruit juices. Overall we loved the location of the resort (in between the loud end and the quiet end of Duval) and we were able to walk almost anywhere from there. The rooms were new, very clean, and cool and that made it the perfect place for us! We would definitely return (maybe in December rather than in July!!)

Reviews.Title: “Super awesome!”
Reviews.Author: tinyevil
Reviews.Content: Awesome super cool place. Great location on sleepier end of duval street and a super nice pool for when it's too hot to move. Grey breakfast and bar! staff couldn't be nicer!

Reviews.Title: “A First-Class Find”
Reviews.Author: mibenco
Reviews.Content: Actually my trip to this property was January 2010 but that wasn't an option to select. This was a GREAT property...drove to Key West without reservations and stumbled upon this freshly-restored vintage motor court in Old Town Key West. The grounds were excellently maintained with an inviting-looking pool and spa, quality outdoor furniture. There's a tiny bar on premises, which I believe is wine only. I had a King suite of some sort...a living room up front, then a split bath (toilet on one side of the hall, beautiful walk-in shower and vanity on the other). Stunning, high-end baths with frameless glass shower enclosure, glass tile, nice amenities and plenty of towels. Two flat-screen TVs. An exceptionally-comfortable king bed in the bedroom. A quiet night's stay despite the convenient location and nearby nightlife. One HUGE plus for Key West: lots of free parking. I will definitely return to this property again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: flgirl82
Reviews.Content: Wow. This place is exactly like the pictures, and all of the great reviews I read prior to our visit were spot on! The grounds were nicely maintained, and the pool/spa was spotless. Our room, a King Suite was perfect. Lots of space, beautiful decor, comfortable bed and very clean! Took advantage of the complimentary breakfast every morning and the complimentary happy hour one evening. If you stay here, you will not be disapppointed.

Reviews.Title: “Dismissive and Unaccountable”
Reviews.Author: travelcn010
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation in mid April for a stay in August (4-8). Email confirmation was not sent and I called to inquire. They had an incorrect address, corrected it and sent it. I saw the confirmation but did not check the dates (my error). When I called to confirm a week prior to the trip the Hotel had the wrong check in date and could not correct it. The woman at the desk was dismissive and unaccountable. I was really looking forward to my stay here as they have a great reputation. I was to be in Key West for an expose on the town as I am a travel editor.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Gypsyking09
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights last week. Room smallish but perfectly formed. Luxurious and enough room for two. Great pool, excellent bar, 6 free drinks tokens- Best Chardonnay in Florida too! Lovely decor/finish. Great location, Virtually no noise! 2 Fabulous staff who added to the experience; Brandon (Reception) Betty (Bar) Could not rave about this place enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: dkchavez99
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to everything. Go right out the hotel a few blocks to the southern most point, go left & you are headed to everything on Duval St.. Don't waste your time taking a Fury Sunset Cruise unless all you want to do is drink beer & wine with people with bottomless glasses. See Sunsets @ Mallory Sq @The Westin marina or the best kept secret in town The Top @ The Crowne Plaza Hotel go into to Starbucks out the back door up the elevator to the Top view all of Key West get there early 7:30pm to get a seat or on the rail to get good pictures of the sunset. Food, Breakfast at the hotel great start to the day coffee, juice, pastry, cereal, toast, bagels, yogurt & fresh fruit, the Peruvian shop right next to the hotel had a good pick up sandwich, Margaritaville good Cuban Sand, Sloppy Joes beer & music, Amigos, Carnita (pork) burrito Big Big, & Seafood a must go is the Boat House. When you check just ask Kim & Brandon they will help you with anything from finding great places to eat, things to do, birthday cake & taxi. Whatever it takes to make you feel welcome and comfortable on your vacation they are there for you the guest. We spent our days at the pool ,quite, most days it was just us after 3:00 is when other guests came. Betty at the Orchid Bar would bring us little samples since it was so hot. Betty welcomed us everyday with a how are you guys today & her smile. We explored Duval St. every night. After our walks we came back to the Orchid Bar for our free drinks & to see Betty's smile. Betty is one of the best in our book. If you are not staying at the Orchid Inn this bar & Betty are a must go to. Betty welcomes everyone with her smile and laughter. We can't say enough about this hotel & the employees everyone makes you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: SummerTraveler34678
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and quiet - not very big, but spacious enough. It was renovated 2 years ago and to the credit of the maintenance and housekeeping staff, the hotel grounds and rooms appeared to be newly refurbished. Staff was very friendly. The hotel has a room off the pool that hosts a continental breakfast in the morning and a relaxing bar in the evening. We were given two drink tickets for each night's stay that went for a free wine or beer or for a half price well drink. This has become "my hotel" to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great little bar at a great Inn”
Reviews.Author: pittHD
Reviews.Content: My friends and I did not stay at this hotel, we stayed at the Almond Tree Inn, which is owend by the same man. When chatting at the Almond Tree, he recommended we try out the bar at this location. My friends and I didn't know what to expect. What we found was a lush resort atmosphere, recently renovated, and a private 6 stool bar room -- it has a great atmosphere. And best was the bartender, Betty. She was a delight. She entertained myself and 2 friends for an hour. And she made great drinks! We learned alot from her about drinks, she has experience running larger locations and it shows. What a nice little diversion on our trip. While there, we met Kim -- she works the front desk and is a true professional -- she gave us a tour of the rooms and we would definitely stay here in the future. So, later that evening before dinner, we brought our 3 other friends and the 6 of us filled the bar and enjoyed another couple rounds. Betty was a joy and entertaining. This little bar is a hidden treasure at a great little Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Best Front Desk ever!”
Reviews.Author: MOMFIRST29
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and especially the front desk! This was the perfect hotel, clean , modern, responsive to your needs plus! Kim at the front desk made our stay so much better! She set up most of our activities from beautiful dinner cruises to sailing and scuba diving! On a busy holiday weekend she got us on everything we were interested in doing. Her help with restaurants and what to see in Key West was pitch perfect! We felt she was a member of the family by the time we left! LOVED OUR STAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: skennedy21
Reviews.Content: We loved the Orchid Key Inn! It was perfectly located on southern end of Duval St, only a brief walk to all of the shopping, bars and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean, with plenty of space. The pool was a very nice place to relax during the day, and the staff even brought out fresh glasses of ice water for guests during the hot days. The happy hour lounge/bar was a great place to hang out and meet other guests. Overall, we have no complaints and will definitely be staying again on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility on Duval Street - what a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Joninotphoney
Reviews.Content: The lush gardens and tranquilly decorated rooms at Orchid Key Inn along with the location at the quiet end of Duval Street combine to create an oasis for you to retreat to in Key West. We stayed two days and we wish that we had stayed longer. There is so much to do in Key West and after you have shopped and dined and snorkeled having your own private oasis to come home to is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: merlin066
Reviews.Content: Very nice place is clean, rooms very confortable, great bathroom and shower is quiet and is near to all great places in duval street. A great placeto stay nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: LoughboroughRachel52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Inn for 3 nights as part of a 2 week holiday to Florida. We booked the hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor. We weren't disappointed, in fact I think it was even better than we expected. The location of the hotel is great, its on Duval Street (at the quieter end) so we were able to walk to restaurants and bars in the evening rather than having to drive. This proved invaluable as the cocktails which they serve in Key West are really strong and really good. The hotel room and bathroom was really modern and clean, there wasn't much space to put our cases though. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. We have a really comfy bed at home and this was even better! The hotel offer complimentary continental breakfast and also a free drink at the bar every night between 6-7pm. We were delighted with the free breakfast as it meant we didn't have to go search for somewhere to eat. Brandon at the hotel was really helpful and patient, he suggested places to eat and visit which he thought would be good for us. He took the time to understand what we would like to do rather than giving a standard response, his knowledge of the island is extensive so definitely speak to him if you visit the hotel. Key West is fabulous, we wished we had stayed longer. The sunset party at the end of Duval Street should not be missed, it was breathtaking. We also had a lovely meal at 915 on Duval Street, the scallops were fab. We went to 2 beaches whilst on the island, the Fort Zacahary Beach and Higgs Beach. At Fort Zachary you have to pay to get in and then pay for sunbeds so it proved quite expensive, there was also no breeze on the beach so it was incredibly hot. It's a pretty beach though. The Higgs Beach was a lot cheaper for beds and there was a really good breeze so it made sunbathing a lot more bearable. Key West was our favourite place during our visit, its very different to the rest of the keys and should not be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: KatieBelle24
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Orchid Key Inn. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was small like others have noted, but it was nice. The pool and hot tub were great, and there were always towels available. The location was perfect. It was an easy walk to all the major bars, restaurants and attractions. We loved the Orchid Bar and the fantastic bartenders (Andrew & Betty). Happy Hour every night was fun. Overall the hotel was very quiet, although there is a rooster nearby that loves to crow in the morning. (It is Key West after all!) We would definitely recommend this wonderful inn!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Linda Margaret
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great breakfast buffet. Hard boil eggs, assorted breads/buns, etc., juices, coffees, pastries, bagels, etc. VERY nice hostess on duty every morning. Swimming pool, plenty of chairs/tables, drinks at poolside. In the sun. Some shade by palms in early morning and late afternoon. Hot tub/spa. Bar on premises. Closes about 10:00-ish PM. Specials daily. Rooms remodeled, marble baths with glass enclosed showers, upper end shampoos/soaps, beds comfy, 4 pillows. Air conditioning superb. We had the suite which had plenty of room and places to store clothes. Two TVs, sofa, chairs, etc. New and modern. Easy on and off of Route 1 into Key West. Denny's on corner open 24 hours if you are getting an early flight out and need breakfast. Cons: At quiet end of Duval (that's good), but a mile+ walk to the sunset viewing and main attractions. Okay if it isn't hot. But walk that a couple of times a day and the Inn gets further and further away. They offer you two comp. drinks per person and snacks between 4-6 PM. Only if you are at the Orchid Key in that two hour span can you redeem your coupons. That is really nice, but three afternoons out of four we were out in the town somewhere. Great if you like to stay in your room around that time, otherwise you kind of feel cheated out of an amenity. There is an $8.00 per day parking fee (on site). After the cost of the room per day, it should be free. The longes at pool side are really uncomfortable. They do not pull upright into a 90 degree angle which is great for reading, drinking coffee/etc. The backward slant just about breaks your back if you want to do something other that bake in the sun. Not many people (when we were there) used them. Last...there really has to be a curfew of sorts. After out all day, wanted to relax by the beautiful pool and waterfall with night lights, have a drink and just enjoy the lovely evening. Right! A group of seven people were drinking, laughing, yelling (not talking), arguing, etc. at roughly 10:00 PM. The pool sits in the C-shape alcove of the Inn and sound echos & magnifies. I felt sorry for anyone who had the rooms around the pool and were trying to relax for the night. Thank goodness our room was around the corner so when we left (after 5 minutes) we couldn't hear them. I would stay there again since the Inn was very clean and modern despite the 50's architecture. And the breakfast was not the usual Continental fare most serve. It was close to the Southern Most Point and the beach there. It just needs tweeking in regards to "quiet hours," parking fees and poolside longe comfort. Otherwise, it still stands as one of the better places to stay that is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: mb2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Orchid Key Inn was pleasant. The location is great, and the rooms are well decorated, smell great, and are very clean. We enjoyed the free cocktails, however it was very , very crowded in the little bar. We were not allowed to have chilled glasses if we took the drinks outside, but there were not any seats in the bar on the second night that we were there. We had the breakfast one of the two days that we were there, and it was very good. The room was very small, and my husband and I kept running into each other. There was not any room to store our clothes or baggage. We had a queen delxue room and the total for two nights stay was $436.50. This was the lowest available rate when we made our reservations. The office is not staffed overnight, but a number is provided in case of an emergency. We were charged for parking, which I didn't think should be required. We have stayed at two other locations in Key West on past vacations, and so far this is our favorite location. If I stayed here again I would want a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: menkjessica
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay in Key West at the Orchid Key Inn. The boutique hotel is super cute, comfy and the staff was wonderful. Everyone was super friendly and accommodating. The hotel is on the "quiet side" of Duval street which was super nice. Our room faced their pool, so it was very quiet at night. It's a nice little getaway in the heart of Key West. Very Clean!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Key West (at least that's how it feels)”
Reviews.Author: efree73
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Orchid Key Inn was the perfect complement to our 1 year anniversary in Key West. The Orchid Key Inn is a nice place to get away and spend a romantic weekend with that special person in your life. The pool area is landscaped beautifully and feels very inviting. Orchid Key gets 5 stars from my wife and I. Even though it is on Duval St., it's still quiet enough to get some peace and quiet if needed. It's within walking distance of all the famous and fun bars and restaurants. We recommend Orchid Key to anyone looking for a quiet place to stay right in the middle of the action. Brandon at the front desk was beyond nice and helpful. He was a wealth of helpful suggestions as to where to go for food and fun. Brandon went out of his way to make our anniversary a special one. He was a delight to say the least and made our stay a very memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cpo527
Reviews.Content: Easy location, nicely renovated rooms, breakfast included around the pool, and Brandon, was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best places to say...”
Reviews.Author: neilmr01
Reviews.Content: Betty our bartender advised us on local entertainment and best other things to do while here.. not to mention being quite the mixologist .. love. ya!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 123SunnyBeach
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Key West and we will be back!!! We stayed for 5 days and couldn't be happier with this little spot! The rooms were spotless and the location was perfect! The staff at the Orchid Key Inn were great too! Trudy, Brandon, and Kim at the Front Desk were super friendly and helped us out with everything we needed! They always had a smile on their face! The Inn has a great happy hour daily and our bartenders Kathy, Jay, and Betty were fantastic! The theme song from Cheers is what I think of when I think of the Orchid Key Inn and the mini vacation that we had. By the end of the stay we made lots of great new friends (Tim,Tom,Gary,Ali:)! I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone! You won't be disappointed!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place and well located”
Reviews.Author: KathyBMW
Reviews.Content: We chose the Orchid Key Inn based on TripAdvisor ratings and it was awesome. Although the room was a bit small it was so well appointed we didn't mind. Everything we needed, and more! I didn't ask for feather pillows but would've preferred them as all the other linens were so luxurious. Great breakfast served attractively and free drink in the late afternoon was appreciated. The pool was clean and quiet. Lots of off street parking but we didn't even get a car because everything except the airport was withing walking distance. Definite recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: annajustine
Reviews.Content: I left the Orchid Key hotel about a week ago, arriving on crutches after a fall while on my holiday in Florida. The rooms were comfy and spotless and stylish. There is a cozy, homely feel to the place. The staff were wonderful and helpful to me at all times. The bar and bar tenders were fabulous. I highly recommend this place. I will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: Sunglasses3000
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 2-6. We loved this place. It has the personal service of a B and B but the feel of a hotel. Rooms are neat, clean, and newly updated with flatscreen TV, fridge, and microwave. Spacious bathroom with huge shower. Lovely small pool just 30 steps outside pur door. Would not recommend kids as we didn't see any there, which made for a more enjoyable experience when lounging at the pool. Happy hour every day starting at 5 with a complimentary drink for every night you are staying there. Great location, 10 min or less stroll to a beach and right on Duvall where some great eats are located. Just far enough from the party area so if you want to walk there you can, but if you want a quiet night in, you can do that too. For food recommend "915", "7 Fish", "Flaming Buoy", and for a great lobster roll check out "DJ's Clam Shack".

Reviews.Title: “Will come back to the Orchid Key Inn!! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: HSkman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Key Inn for our first year anniversary, and we had no idea what hotel to choose b/c i'd never been to Key West before so I trusted the high rating on Trip Advisor and chose the Orchid Key Inn. The quality you get for the price is EXCELLENT! The rooms are nice and modern. The atmosphere is very relaxed and you don't get a lot of noise from the street. We loved the pool area and the one free complimentary drink per evening. My most favorite part was the kindness of the staff and excellent service on providing their opinions of the best places to eat and to go in Key West. Brandon was awesome in helping out with providing options! Thanks for a great stay and we will come back to the Orchid Key next time!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Picktrip
Reviews.Content: Driving in we were a bit underwhelmed but check in won us over. This is truly a full service inn! They made us dinner reservations and Brandon at the front desk went out of his way to make us feel at home. Happy hour and breakfast add to the experience. Room finishes and pool both exceed expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but really lacking in certain things, not good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: tomkim5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 4 day getaway from Miami on y a busy week in May. Quick summary below: Pros - Great central location on Duval Street, just south of all the action - High quality fitout and amenities in the rooms - Friendly and helpful front office staff - Free glass of wine during happy hour everyday Cons - Price is at the high range - Rooms are tiny tiny tiny - No dedicated concierge - Styrofoam/plastic everything for breakfast (unexcusable at this price point) - Quality of continental breakfast is mediocre Bottom line: My review would be much more favorable if this hotel were significantly less expensive but at their current price points, you deserve to get much more. Particularly noticable was the cheap breakfast with styrofoam cups, paper plates, and plastic utensils. Quality of the continental breakfast itself was so so but everything is pre-sweetened including the granola, cereals, and yoghurt so you might have a problem if you're not into processed foods like we are. I think there is much better value for money elsewhere but we won't know until we try a few more places on future trips. There appear to be some nice places on the Southernmost area which are priced very similar to Orchard Key that appear to offer a fuller service hotel experience which we will be trying next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Abbeecan
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms that wrap around pool and tiki bar. Very friendly travellers seem to find this hidden gem. Close to all attractions,and the staff will help recommend the tour that would best fit with your style.We had a super great stay. thanks to all the staff at the orchid key Inn

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, very modern!”
Reviews.Author: Nani36
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, breakfast included. My room had a microwave, coffe maker, and a mini fridge. The only negative is you had to pay $8 for parking per day. But it beats looking for parking on duval street!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Shoechick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Key West two nights before our cruise. We booked Orchid Key based on TripAdvisor reviews and as usual, they weren't wrong. As other reviews have stated, it's right in the middle of the action, but very quiet. We booked a one bedroom suite and were thrilled. Free breakfast was a complete surprise. We enjoyed great drinks at happy hour and a bargain of $8 parking. We'd go back to Orchid Key in a heart beat, next time for longer. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for a few nights.”
Reviews.Author: kh7903
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we booked 2 nights at the Orchid Key Inn for our first visit to Key West. It is literally right in the middle of all of the action, on the main street. You can walk anywhere from this great location. When we drove up, I was a little worried of what we had booked, as it looks a little older from the outside. The rooms were a welcome surprise though - very new and updated. The pool scene is certainly not "happening", but it is nice if you want to take a quick dip. The free breakfast was a great perk each day, along with the 2 free drinks at happy hour. For the price (compared to everything else on the island), this place was great and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KrisMac70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orchid Key Inn during the first week of May with my wife and 2 other couples. My wife and I had never been to Key West. Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted by Brandon. He was extremely courteous and helpful as we three couples checked in. All of the rooms overlook the pool except three. The pool was very clean and the pool area was very accommodating. Fresh beach towels on every chair, comfortable lounge chairs, plenty of sun and shade, and tables/chairs for eating. Our room had a King bed, closet, fridge, microwave, pocket door to bathroom, and an impressive flat screen tv. The room was very clean and inviting, perfectly decorated, and a great size. The service we received during our stay was top notch. Brandon even let me park the rental car overnight, at no charge, when I ran into a problem returning it to the agency. I would recommend this hotel very highly. I already recommended it to a friend who will be honeymooning in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate with great location”
Reviews.Author: Asherzmom
Reviews.Content: Yes...as people have said, it is small. It has about 24 rooms, and looks quite unassuming from the road. The location is perfect. You are on Duval, but on the quiet end, so you don't hear a thing, even on weekends. The size makes the pool always wide open, and the rooms close to the pool. The rooms are TINY. That was the only downfall. We had a king bed, and this would have been much better if we had a queen. Super comfy and nice beds though. The bathrooms are adequate with a suprisingly large shower. Our shower water pressure was horrible for about 3 days. This was OUR fault though because we didn't even think to ask to have it checked, assumed it was island water pressure. We finally casually asked and had it fixed immediately (duh). Brandon at the front desk was GREAT for local information. The bartender/breakfast staff was good, but really not super friendly or attentive. Great happy hour, a free drink per night and wonderful breakfast. We spent more than we wanted on the hotel, but we really loved it overall. Loved the nice quiet, intimate setting.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel101_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice and has a convenient location to Duvual Street. The decor is wonderful. The staff was very helpful except the bartender. She was not very friendly and helpful at all. She totally ignored us and turned her back to us, when we asked her questions about Key West.

Reviews.Title: “So cute! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganTiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location! It right on Duval st so it is a super short walk to everything!! We were greeted by a very friendly staff. The pool is small but clean and the pool area is super cute. They have a cute little bar in front of the pool that serves drinks in the evening and breakfast in the morning. Its clear the rooms were updated recently as they are decorated very nicely and the bathroom is great! When I visit Key West again, this will be my first choice! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Small but luxury!”
Reviews.Author: igm
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Room was small but decor was trendy and luxury. Hotel is at the quiet end of Duval St which was perfect for us. Paid around $8 per night for parking which was the going rate. Vouchers for free drinks at happy hour came in handy and the free breakfast was lovely. The pool was well kept and towels were provided for the beds. Staff were friendly and overall this hotel had a great vibe. Key West was buzzing with it being Spring Break. Loads of choise of restaurants and we loved Hemmingway's House and Sunset at Mallory Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: li_fitz
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was charming and has a great location. Everyone on the staff was so helpful. The pool is small, but quite comfortable. The rooms are decorated very nice. This will be the place that I revisit on my next trip. Also, as a single woman traveling solo, felt very comfortable here.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BOB_Phila-Pa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orchid Key Inn for 2 nights and found all the reviews in Trip Advisor were spot on. This is a great place to stay.....nicely appointed, spotless rooms with a king size bed and flat screen TV. Staff were very nice - happy to answer questions and offer restaurant suggestions throughout our stay. WI-fI was included and worked flawlessly. A generous continental breakfast is offered each morning. We arrived late in In the afternoon and were happy to learn that happy hour included a free drink (wine or beer) from the bar. The grounds are beautifully landscaped with orchids displayed around the property. Lounge chairs and tables surround the pool and create a pleasant atmosphere to enjoy breakfast, happy hour, or simply soak up the sun. Restaurants and attractions are all within easy walking distance. Tour trains stop across the street. Parking is also available on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place... Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: alphadogco
Reviews.Content: Small, Chic, hip with a great locale, and excellent rooms on the pool:)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel to enjoy Key West”
Reviews.Author: hmdbfd
Reviews.Content: Usually my husband and I search for unique B&Bs when we vacation. Friends and family assured us that we wanted to be more centrally located for our first visit to Key West. Orchid Key Inn exceeded our expectations. The King suites were nicely appointed, and the staff could not have been more helpful. Kim, Brandon, and Trudi at the main desk were invaluable in making reservations, finding out of the way restaurants and suggesting locations for local flavor, They helped us make the most of our stay! What is most interesting is that so many of the locals knew about the Inn and had very positive reports about the facility and its bar, which is tucked away in back beside the pool! The Spring Break crowds were not even noticeable at The Orchid Key. Breakfast was quiet and relaxed at small tables poolside! Best of all, the Inn is within easy walking distance of all the major Key West attractions, shopping, museums, restaurants, and the beach at the southern most point. If you are not paying attention, you could easily walk past the Inn as you stroll Duval Street. We would happily stay at the Orchid Key again!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: RAH1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Key for 3 days and it was excellent. The rooms are spotless and very classy although a little small. King size bed with flat screen tv on the wall, WI-FI and safe. The bathroom shower however is huge and very nice. We also enjoyed the free breakfast at the pool, fantastic coffee, tasty pastries, bagels, muffins etc... In the afternoon you get a free drink, beer or wine from the bar. The pool is adequate in size clean and a pleasant temperature. There are many restaurants and attractions within easy walking distance. The Conch trains has a stop right across the street form the hotel. I wish I could have stayed longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: happy_riad_fan
Reviews.Content: We loved this place in Key West. It's quite small, with relatively small rooms and a small pool. However, we never had trouble finding anywhere to sit by the pool - there's enough space to relax and it's pretty, sparkling clean, and there's a lovely hot tub. The location is great - it's easy to reach and includes free parking and being on Duval Street, it's right in the centre of the old town with cafes restaurants and shops. Hemingway's house and the lightghouse are about 150 metres away and it's a short walk to the butterfly conservatory and beaches on the south side of the island. There's a free breakfast buffet by the pool, free wifi and a huge new plasma TV. The pool itself felt very quiet and peaceful, even though it's so close to Key West's main street; the motel mainly appeals to couples so it had a very couple-y, grown up atmosphere. The rooms themselves are small, but the great big beds are comfy and the bathrooms are smart and sparkling. Our rate included free drinks during happy hour, too. Overall a very friendly, grown-up, peaceful place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, classy, chic, Great location, Pricey”
Reviews.Author: traveltina
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this place except that I thought the room rate was expensive. Yes, it is Key West. Yes, it was peak season. Yes, it was a weekend. But still, bottom line, I think it was expensive. As everyone else has said, it is very, very well done. The attention to detail is spot on. Loved the water features--it truly adds such a serene atmosphere to the pool area. Loved sitting in the pool lounger & being able to see the top of the Key West Lighthouse! After breakfast, we walked over to the Hemingway House & did the tour--it was great! I thought the breakfast was so fresh & well done. Great coffee. Loved the wine at "happy hour". All the furnishings & finishes in the room (& outside too) were top notch. Super quiet at night. We were able to walk to Blue Heaven (a favorite stop of ours) & also at night, the nearby Better than Sex (for dessert).....only a few blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Funky Key West”
Reviews.Author: ronvoyage
Reviews.Content: My honey and I stayed two nights at the Orchid Key Inn in Key West, Florida. This hotel is an oasis in the funky city of Key West. The hotel is perfectly located on Duval Street and only a few blocks away from all the activities. The front desk staff is outstanding and has a wealth of information and suggestions of what to do in KW. It looks like this property was remodeled into a first class hotel. We stayed in room 107 which is located on the inner court next to the pools. The room had tile floors, 42â€� flat screen LG TV, fast/free WiFi, and a first class bed. The bathroom was tastefully done with a large walk-in shower. Our rate included a beverage and munchies at 5:00pm and a better than average continental breakfast. Parking was an additional $8.00 per night which is a bargain in KW. Key West is not a bargain in April. However, the overall experiences at the Orchid Inn were a great value and worth the four hour drive from Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: besos22
Reviews.Content: Our room exceeded my expectations and I loved that it was right by the pool and bar. You would think that it would be loud in that area, but it definitely wasn't. Our concierge was great. She had excellent restaurant recommendations and assisted us with reservations and booking our sunset cruise. Kathy was also great at the bar. She had excellent wine recommendations and I now have a new favorite wine because of her : ). My boyfriend and I would definitely stay here again. Thank you for a great experience Orchid Key Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay and the location was perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jerseymikes1315
Reviews.Content: Just a great place!! We arrived on a Monday afternoon after driving from Miami. We were met with friendly staff who checked us in promptly and gave us several free drink passes for the onsite bar. After getting a drink we went to our room and we were pleasantly surprised. Flat panel tv, ipod docking station, and wireless internet Our room was neat and clean and was far enough away from the street that you rarely heard any of those scooters buzz by. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to my friends and family. We were extremely pleased

Reviews.Title: “What a great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tkdlr
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Key West to celebrate my 62nd birthday. Orchid Key is just off Duval Street and an easy walk to Mallory Square or Southernmost. This was our 7th visit to Key West, but our first stay at Orchid Key, and we would certainly stay there again. The rooms are small, but who goes to Key West to stay in a hotel room? The pool was not large, but neither was it ever crowded, nor was the hot tub. We had room # 117, which is off the pool area and we never heard any noise from the street. Drink coupons are provided for the little bar, although it gets crowded during happy hour. The staff couldn't have been any nicer and they certainly deserve our return business.

Reviews.Title: “Will absolutely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborAmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights earlier this month and absolutely loved it. In prior years we have stayed at the Marriott but this year we wanted to be on Duval St (or nearby). We picked this place based on other Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The hotel was hip, fun, clean, and had a nice continental buffet breakfast. There is a nice little bar there as well and they give you happy hour coupons when you check in. The staff was fabulous and the hotel is very centrally located. We walked down Duval St. numerous times and if we were tired at night we hopped a pedi-cab back from Mallory Square. We also really appreciated that they let us park our car really early so we could walk around before we checked in. We highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: mamalyn27407
Reviews.Content: We make almost all reservations based on Trip Advisor, and they were right on once again. Don't let the sign and the outward appearance of this little place turn you off. It looks like a retro 60's motel, but it is much more than that. The rooms are very nice and very clean. The bathrooms are totally modern, with a wonderful glass shower ( no tub for you bathers) and great shower head. The breakfast consists of cereal in boxes, not generic like many hotels now, bread, bagels, yogurt and fruit. In the evening there is a bar that is open by the pool. You will get two coupons for free drinks and there are peanuts, crackers and cheese, etc. The location is also great. You can catch the Conch Train across the street. It is only a few blocks to the Southernmost Point or going the other way, it is about 10 blocks to the sunset celebration at Mallory Square. There is a laundromat in the next block if you need to wash clothes. Everyone we encountered at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful in giving directions, etc. As one reviewer said, the only thing bad you could say about this place is there are no chairs in the rooms, just a bench which we put our suitacase on.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Place To Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: NWY
Reviews.Content: This place was really spectacular. It was right in the middle of everything. It was exceptionally clean and the staff was very helpful. The bartender was very informative and helpful in giving us things to do, as we had never been to Key West. We will go back and stay here again and would highly recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best little boutique motel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Guidor
Reviews.Content: Consistently the No.1 Hotel on Trip Advisor. Having stayed there for 6 nights we can see why this privately owned motel has earned . The rooms are immaculately renovated, quality Egyptian cotton sheets, high end fixtures and fittings. Bathrooms are stunning. Breakfasts are simple, freshly prepared and very tasty. Staff are helpful, courteous and meticulous in keeping the place spotlessly clean. (Thanks Brandon, Kim et al). We will stay there again. The only downside is that this is now the benchmark against which we will judge all other hotels we stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Key West”
Reviews.Author: buckles16
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent visitor to Key West, but selected the Orchid Key because of the great reviews. The location is great, just to the "beginning" of the quiet side of Key West (altho make sure your room is not on the street side.) The place is an old 60's motel that was completely done over, but maintained the retro feel. Beautiful pool, jacuzzi, the rooms are well appointed, great bathroom/shower. The happy hour is thrown in as an extra, but only entitles you beer and wine. Mostly, the wine was barely drinkable, and I am not fussy. But, who says they need to give anything away? Other drinks are not happy hour discounted and they are pricey. ..some of the drinks are very unique..had one that was wonderful at the end of our stay. They really should have one of their "specials" discounted for happy hour. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful. BYW this is a GREAT value for Old Key West..beachfronts like Southernmost are fabulous but cost hundreds more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and trendy oasis”
Reviews.Author: Shoegal1313
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchid Key with 8 other people in November 2010 and was impressed with the service, cleanliness, and atmosphere at this very cute inn. When I go back to Key West, I will stay there again. No bed bugs. Only surprise: we did not know about the wild chickens that roam all over Key West and I am afraid everyone in this town is awakened by the roosters around 6am. There was one "singing" just outside my room.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding facility in a GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Sam1938
Reviews.Content: A small newly renovated motel in a wonderfully convenient location on Duval Street. Walk to everything. Clean rooms open onto the pool/hot tub/patio area where you can eat the included continental breakfast. The rooms are small but adequate. Included: Microwave, refrigerator, safe, ironing board, hair dryer, wonderful linens. The only thing lacking is a chair or two in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Plaxa
Reviews.Content: Returned to the Orchid Key Inn once again, had to work with my dates as they are extremely booked during this time of the year. Couldn't have been any better. While we were there they were updating their landscaping but did it with the least disturbance to the guest. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay with convenient location & nice folks !”
Reviews.Author: chicodkid
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel. We were next to the pool area behind the office & away from street noise. Extemely quiet, be sure to stay next to pool area. Nice complimentary breakfast served poolside at your leisure each morning. Very courteous staff, I could talk to them like friends. Large plasma TV mounted on wall. Comfortable bed. If you have never stayed in KW before, don't expect a huge room, this was cozy with a nice bathroom with walk in shower, No tub, but did have a jacuzzi in pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Another satisifed customer!!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2globetrot
Reviews.Content: Add us to the list of those who loved this hotel! We stayed in a king deluxe room for $250 a night plus tax. Though this is expensive, it does seem comparable to other hotels in Key West. It has been wonderfully renovated and the decor is modern, fresh and hip. There is free wi-fi, free continental breakfast poolside which included hard boiled eggs, cereals, pastries, breads, fruit, yogurt, coffee, juice. They also gave us each a card for one free happy hour cocktail or beer for each day we stayed. We stayed 4 nights so we each got 4 cards and you could use them all in one night or 1 each night, or any other combo (not limited to just one per night). The happy hour also included free snacks (cheese, crackers, celery, dip). There is a fee of $8 plus tax per night for parking. The spaces were tight and the parking lot was mostly full the whole time we were there but we did always get a space. The rooms and location have been discussed here plenty, so I won't elaborate much, but we agree that the location is awesomeâ€¦we walked everywhere! And the hotel was quiet. The rooms are a bit small. There is not a lot of space to unpack. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was great! The bathroom was stocked with Bath & Body Works products (a nice touch), a full size hair dryer and had ample counter space. There was also a mini fridge, coffee maker, microwave, safe, radio/alarm clock with dock for mp3 player, iron and ironing board. My only complaint with the room was the fact that even though the air conditioning made the room cool, it did not get the humidity out of the room. Maybe there was a different setting we were supposed to be using, but I tend to think it was just an insufficient AC for getting the humidity level down. Small complaint, but just mentioning in case they can do something about it. There is a CVS located 0.1 mi away which was great for snacks, water, sodas, etc. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! Special shout out to Kim who was gave us lots of tips on where to go and even gave us a coupon for a free drink at Aqua for a drag show. She and Brendan were both super nice! Overall, we loved this hotel and would stay there again. If you are looking for a water view, youâ€™ll have to stay somewhere else, but will probably pay much more. If you want to be in the heart of Old Town within walking distance to all the sights, this is a great neighborhood! Mallory Square is a 1 mile walk, Hemingway house is 0.2 mi away, Southernmost Point is 0.4 mi and Higgs Beach is a 1.1 mile walk. And walking is a great, fun way to get around Old Town! So many interesting houses, shops, bars, restaurants to explore! Highly recommend Orchid Key Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: jhcovert
Reviews.Content: The Orchid Key Inn, which we were informed has recently come under new management, was a real blessing. Key West, as many people know, is many things to many people, but the main drag (Duval St) is kind of like Spring Break for 60 year olds during the high season. There are people out at all hours drinking and cavorting, and during the day it's usually a traffic jam of bikes, cars, pedestrians with overstimulated children, and whizzing scooters on Duval. The Orchid Key Inn is right on Duval St, close to all bars and restaurants, and yet you feel the pressures of none of those common street occurrences. I stayed with my extended family and the rooms were clean and modern with a solid central A/C unit. The pool area is small, but calm, well maintained and plentifully stocked with towels and surrounded by tropical foliage. It's open 24 hours a day and there's a hot tub tucked into the corner, which is a nice treat after a day of walking and swimming, and a night of drinking and eating. At the time of our stay they offered an included breakfast (7-10am) which was really a nice surprise: yogurts, a variety of breads, hard boiled eggs, cereals, fruit, coffee, tea and different juices. They also offered us a few complimentary drink tickets for use during Happy Hour at their small, but intimate and highly enjoyable wine/martini bar. All in all, the Orchid Key Inn made fans of us: I'd definitely recommend it to my friends and if they can keep this up then I'll be back again for certain.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: golfingirl_laura
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have spent 4 nights at this great little hotel for a quick vacation this February. We struggled to find a place online to stay at. Key West is not an inexpensive destination. We bit the bullet and decided to stay at this little gem just off the quiet end off Duvall. We are so glad we did. The location is superb. We walked everywhere! The rooms are modern & beautifully decorated although a bit on the small side. The staff was pleasant and helpful. They serve a simple and fresh extended continental breakfast in the morning at the poolside bar. We thoroughly enjoyed sitting around the beautiful pool area surrounded by tropical plants, sipping our coffee in the morning. A relaxing way to start our day. The beds are comfortable but not particularly luxurious. The pillows were cheap & lumpy. Such a small thing would've made this stay nearly perfect. Since there are only 24 rooms that surround a private pool area, it is an intimate setting for couples. I wouldn't recommend it for families or party goers. Unfortunately, there were a group of people staying there that were particularly loud and obviously intoxicated at times. They weren't horribly disruptive but someone did tell them to quiet down. I think it was another guest since there is nobody working at night. A small thing that was no fault of the hotel at all. All in all, we will be back. Expensive, but on par with other hotels. You can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Great little Inn”
Reviews.Author: annika326
Reviews.Content: This inn was remodeled in 2008 and they did it right. Originally a 50's motel it is now a cute boutique inn with flat screen TV's, choice bed linens, modern bathrooms, safe, microwave, etc. The rooms are very small but what more do you need in Key West. The location is perfect at the quieter end of Duval Street. We walked to almost everything. The staff bent over backwards to help us with details It was not cheap..$300 a night including tax but nothing in Key West is cheap this time of year, Don't miss the Cat Man at Mallory Square at sunset....he is weird but the cats are great. Also, buy a ticket for the Old Town Trolley which takes you all over Key West. You can hop on and off the 12 stops any time and right now a promotion has the price of the ticket ($23) good for 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: SlySugar
Reviews.Content: The Orchid Key Inn is conveniently located on Duval Street...close enough to the action but far enough for a quiet night's sleep and privacy. It is a 'boutique' inn with a select number of first floor rooms (approx. 20) - most surround the lovely pool/courtyard. The room is stylish (Key West decor), clean and sleek. Ample room is provided; Our experience was everything and more than we expected based on the previous guests' comments...We plan to return next year (2012) and would highly recommend this inn to all visitors of Key West. Susan R. - 2/21/2011

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations - outstanding service and location”
Reviews.Author: Jewels1099
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Key West...it won't be our last! Our room was very clean and the maid service was excellent. We had the Jr. suite and would highly recommend it to anyone. The Jacuzzi tub was a plus after a long day in the sun. The location was perfect. We never heard any noise and got wonderful nights sleep. The "happy hourâ€� coupons were an added bonus to starting the evening off to a great start. The hotel provided a nice continental breakfast, but my husband wanted more "meat.' We ended up walking a few blocks down to the Southernmost Hotel restaurant...every morning. Well worth the short walk to a beautiful outdoor restaurant on the beach. Thank you Orchid Key, weâ€™ll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the stay, did not like the bartender”
Reviews.Author: spietrowski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid before the bar was opened and got to go to the Almond Tree "sister property" for the happy hour there. The stay was wonderful that time, and we enjoyed happy hour very much. This time we were given random "1 drink per person" ticket per night for their "happy hour" here which was less than happy, given the surly nature of the bartender. Then we got some cheese, without crackers, along with the attitude. The "BAR" seems to be on a profit binge instead of a complimentary addition to the price of the rooms. Do stay here for the place but do not count on the happy hour for "Happy"

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...but doesn't seem very "key west" to me....”
Reviews.Author: SugarGroveBride
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, GREAT staff! We really enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend this hotel to friends. The only things that kept it from being a complete "five star rating" for me were the following.... 1 - The beds were great, but the pillows were flat and didn't match the comfy beds. 2 - Stayed 5 nights and would have really liked to have had the sheets changed. I'm sure they would have had I asked though....just tend to expect it after night # 3 in any hotel over $200 per night. 3 - Not enough bike racks. 4 - No ceiling fan in the room. We stayed at the Almond Tree last year, which I understand is a sister property to the Orchid Key, and both propertys are VERY WELL managed and staffed. In terms of the "key west vibe", we sorta preferred the Almond Tree. The Orchid Key is a bit more of a Miami feel. Both nice, just depends on what you prefer.... One more thing about the staff....every single person we encountered who worked at this hotel was super friendly...and not that kind of "i have to be nice because it's my job" type of friendly, but the "these folks seem like really great people" kind of friendly :)

Reviews.Title: “Very clean - great value!”
Reviews.Author: BHGardenGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a two day tour of Key West. While the rooms are small, they are decorated to feel large. Rooms are exceptionally clean, the showers/bathrooms were top notch. This is a great value on Key West. The only issue is that to location is mid-way from the action. It is only about 5 blocks from where the better shopping starts and 10 blocks to Mallory Square. We walked it several times and it went very quickly. (Stopping at Jimmy Buffets helps break up the walk!!!) Great place and highly recommended by both of us

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Amazzed
Reviews.Content: This retro-classic motel is beautiful, super convenient, and absolutely unique. My husband and I enjoyed a two day escape down to Key West during the Christmas week and were absolutely thrilled when we arrived at the Orchid Key Inn. The photos that you see on their website accurately portray the beauty of the Inn. The location is perfect and tucked far enough away (but not too far) from the hustle and bustle of Duvall Street. The rooms are clean and beautiful, the pool area is relaxing, quiet and with that tropical feel that we all yearn for in the wintertime. The private bar at the pool area not only serves up the best "continental" breakfast I've ever had, but their choice of top shelf liquors and wines during the cocktail hours are unbeatable. Brandon and Sean and the rest of the staff at the Inn are extremely accommodating and provide A+ customer service. Our two day stay was definitely not long enough and we booked a longer stay with them even before we checked out. When we got back to Boston, we raved about the Orchid Key Inn to our friends so much that it was an easy task to recruit 5 of our friends to join us in late March-early April. We can't wait to go back! A special mention to Stewie who is Brandon's adorable dachshund puppy whose picture I've attached to this review.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and inviting”
Reviews.Author: voyageur08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchid Key Inn for five nights on a holiday in Key West. It's a retro motel that has been beautifully updated with lots of attention to detail. The rooms are set around a nice pool and hot tub surrounded by palms and tropical plants. Continental breakfast and complimentary happy hour drinks are served in the adjacent bar and you can enjoy them by the pool.
