Rooms are nicely decorated with good bathrooms (great showers) and have a microwave and bar fridge. Only downside is that they are small and you can't really unpack your suitcase. Easy walk to lots of bars, restaurants and sights. We enjoyed this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and were very happy with the location and service. My only complaint are the pillows. They are foam and hard. The pool is very clean and it feels like you are away from the hustle and bustle of Duval St. We will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Booking my next stay within 7 days”
Reviews.Author: thekramergroup
Reviews.Content: This lovely place was recommended by a friend who lives in KW. I simply can't wait to get back. Just needed some me time and slipped away for a day. Slept soundly like I haven't in a long time. Rooms are impeccably clean. Bright colors and modern decor. Loved the shower, amenities, happy hour and breakfast, in that order! A touch of class in everything. Perfect location. Close to the action on Duval, yet tucked away from the noise, hustle and bustle of the nighttime party crowd. My only regret is not being able to stay longer. The staff is A+. I will see you soon!! Thanks for a perfect getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: EricWeise
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 7 nights at Orchid Key Inn. Upon arrival we were greeted by Brandon, which was the nicest hotel lobbyist we had ever dealt with. He went above and beyond his job by booking reservations for us at restaurants, as well as guiding us in the right direction with places to go and see. Every evening we would ask his opinion on where he would recommend us to go based on what we were looking for. Never once did he disappoint us with the selections. The rooms at this property are very nice and clean. The bathrooms feature a large tile shower with glass enclosure. The maid service always did a nice job everyday making up the rooms. Every morning the grounds keeper Andy would empty the trash around the whole property outside. Not only did he empty the trash bins but he went to the extent of wiping them all down on the outside each time to be sure they were clean. The property is very clean and well kept. Everywhere you look there is attention to detail. The hot tub was always clean as well as the pool. The continental breakfast that was served each morning was very nice with multiple things to choose from with a variety of options. This was not your typical continental breakfast at your average hotel, neither was the service. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody looking to stay in Key West, Florida. The location was perfect, it was close to the beach and within walking distance to all of Duval Street. Thanks to everyone at the Orchid Key Inn for allowing us to have a great vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, great location, rooms were small”
Reviews.Author: jmrdel
Reviews.Content: Great location, in a quiet section of Duval Street but a short walk to all of the shops and restaurants. Rooms were very modern and well appointed, though storage space was extremely limited - we had to live out of our suitcases. The room had a big flat-screen TV, but strangely was not HD. A decent continental breakfast is included, along with a free drink at happy hour, as long as you get there between 5:00 and 6:00. Parking cost $8 per day - not sure why this was not complimentary. The office staff was helpful, but we had one unfortunate incident. The person in the office recommended a fine dining restaurant, and told us we had reservations. When we arrived, they had never heard of us or the person from our hotel, and we ended up at a much less elegant place because it was a Saturday night and by then all of the good places were booked. The desk clerk later expressed anger at the restaurant but only offered us a half-hearted apology. Hopefully this was an isolated incident. After that we booked our own reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place, you'll have no problems staying here...”
Reviews.Author: Gillybeanio
Reviews.Content: ...the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. Rooms are small but very comfortable and the complimentary early evening drink and nibbles was a lovely touch. Excellent location for walking to all the sights in Key West. My husband and I had a lovely mid week break here, in fact, we enjoyed it so much we stayed for an extra night!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST experience!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelHaik
Reviews.Content: The 5 star reviews are well deserved. After reading the reviews, I called to make a reservation and talked to Brandon who was most helpful and booked my reservation for my first trip to Key West. Upon arrival, Brandon was at the front desk and provided me with all the 411 I could ask for. This is the best remodeled hotel I have ever visited. It is very apparent that they spared no expense on the details of the rooms. The only slight flaw were the pillows-a little to bouncy for my tastes. Happy hour was great in the intimate but elegant bar. Great location-great value-flawless service. Complimentary breakfast was very good. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: A-Steel-Guy
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the orchid key in key west. The bar had everything we needed and the pool was great. Happy hour was unlimited free beer and wine then and the rates were less. We really wanted to stay again for our trip in april 2011 but we since we stay for 9 nights the new expense, just didn't make sense. I called, but was told it was the best they could do. We ended up booking a condo on duval for this next trip in april, but we really wanted to take our 9 lb yorkie and orchid key changed thier policy on dogs too. Anyway it's a nice place and we'll visit the bar on the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: travelswithboy
Reviews.Content: Nice nice nice staff...... trip was worth it for the Gin&Juice signature drink in the bar. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LLLIKENS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at OKI Thanksgiving week for our 2nd time and it didn't disappoint! We were able to check in early to our king room, which allowed us to be at Blue Heaven for lunch by 1 pm! The room was clean and the king size bed comfy as always. Brandon (& Stewart) and Sean help make our stay relaxing and fun. There is nothing the staff wouldn't help out with. And with the great location, there is nothing but good things to say. Thank you! We look forward to our next return trip

Reviews.Title: “The best in key west!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SandraE27526
Reviews.Content: We were early but our room was ready. The room was great, everything we needed and then some. The whirlpool was outstanding, it was too cold for the pool but staff put fresh beach towels out every morning. Breakfast in the bar was the standard fare, and we got coupons at check-in for free drinks at happy hour. Even though it is right on Duval street (very easy for out of towners in a rental car to find) it was not too noisy to sleep. Housekeeping did a fabulous job. This really is the best in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Key West - staff is wonderful but no good wifi”
Reviews.Author: kateverod
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nghts at the OKI and it was fantastic! The rooms are very clean and the staff was helpful and nice. We stayed in a king room that was right off the pool courtyard which was very nice - reduces the street noise and really is only a bit noisy while the bar is open in the evening. It is at the quiet end of Duval - great access to bike rental, laundromat & CVS. My advice is stay at the quieter end of town and rent bikes to get anywhere on the island. Pros: Staff, location, pool courtyard, comfy bed, very clean room, free drink per person during happy hour, continental breakfast Cons: wifi does not work (maybe in front of lobby but not anywhere else I tried), fridge in room froze drinks & food. Eat at El Siboney (cuban), Blue heaven (pricey but good breakfast!), A&B - happy hour clam bucket and drinks are the best, B.O's fish wagon - split a fish sandwich. Go to Westin near Mallory Square and reserve boat ride (6 min) to Lattitudes retaurant for sunset key wonderful lunch or dinner (pricey but beautiful!). Things to see & do: Rent a bike - so worth it! Fort Zach - beach and fort - ride don't walk in. Sea plane to dry tortugas - pricey but incredible! Sunset sail on Adrondack II! White street pier for sunset, southernmost cafe and pier for sunset and happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect price, perfect staff, perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: epm96
Reviews.Content: I really didn't have a ton of faith being that this was number 1 on trip advisor and right in the heart of duval street. I was greats with a great wall I. Rate, received a king suite and 2 free drink vouchers and half off of drinks during happy hour. The room was perfect, decorated with real furniture not hotel junk, the shower was great (but needed more pressure but that's the keys), our room had two brand new 42inch plasmas. I was really amazed at this hotel for this price in this location. Guess they really should be number 1

Reviews.Title: “No regrets”
Reviews.Author: duke_of_omnium
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I stayed here when we were married at the Hemingway House (two short blocks away). The rooms were small, but very nicely appointed, and the motel itself is at the quieter end of Duval Street. The free breakfast was OK, about like you'd find in a business hotel chain. The architecture resembles those cheap motels that sprang up in the 50's and 60's. In fact, it would not surprise me to find that the Orchid Key had begun life as just such a place; Key West is full of buildings that have been endlessly recycled. If so, they've outdone themselves in redecorating. The closets were small but adequate (except that they weren't tall enough for my fiancÃ©e's gown). My only quibble was that when we requested an extended checkout to change clothes after the 11:00 ceremony (this was the checkout time, as well), we were told that the room was reserved for the night, and they could not allow it. It worked out for us, but given the price of the room, I wish they could have accommodated us. Parking was $8 a day for the uncovered and unsecured lot. If this was any other town, I would have been highly incensed; for Key West, it was a positive bargain. Most of the town's attractions are within a 15 minute walk, whether you're drunk or sober.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a motel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: SouthernWoman55
Reviews.Content: The Orchid Key Inn was excellent in all ways. Brandon was so helpful in requesting restaurants that were all fabulous, along with Sean. The room was sooo comfortable from the mattress and bedding. The new design of the rooms were very well done and makes you feel very relaxed, in your time away. The location was perfect on Duvall Street, The location on Duvall Street is great and just far enough away from the busyness of Duvall. I really cannot think of anything that we did not like, but if I had to say something it would be the roosters native to the city. They crowed sometimes in the wee morning hours. Of course, they were there long before I was. I would highly recommend this motel and if ever in The Keys again, there will be no doubt of where I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: mjannazzo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchid Key Inn for our wedding weekend in November. This place is awesome! The location is perfect and the rooms are beautiful! They have a great pool and bar, with a complimentary drink at happy hour, and the complimentary breakfast was delicious! We loved that when we entered our room after our wedding they had put rose petals on the bed and had champagne chilling for us. It was wonderful! If you visit Key West, stay here. You will love it. Jack and Brandon are fantastic hosts!! We can't say enough about this place - it's the best!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: cweintraub
Reviews.Content: This place is even better than you can imagine! Ultra modern and hip in a "Rat Pack" sort of way. Upper end of Duval is just delightful with lots of locals who have wonderful tales to tell. Hugs and kisses to Brandon at the front desk and Siobhan and Andrew who both mix killer drinks at the chic little bar! Cannot wait to visit again! Christine & Marc W Palm Harbor Fl.

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Ron-from-NY
Reviews.Content: I just finished my three night stay at the Orchid Key Inn, and everything went very well. I was able to check in early with no problems. The staff was very helpful and attentive, and the room was cleaned well everyday. The room was decorated with modern furniture and appliances , and had a clean modern bathroom. . It was much nicer then I expected it to be judging from the look of it from the outside. The pool area was small but very nice. I used the hottub a couple of times and it was always clean. The location was great. I could walk to everything. I would definitely recommend this place. I wouldn't say it was a good value at around 200 a night, but it was not overpriced either. Had a great time in Key West!!

Reviews.Title: “Made our honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: TeamRooR
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the orchid key inn!! There was not a thing I didn't like! The best location!!! Rooms were super clean, modern and overall just well taken care of. Comfy bed and sheets!! Very sexy bathroom!! Got to love a fridge and microwave! Brandon was super nice and very helpful! When I come back to key west I will without a doubt stay at he orchid key inn!!! And if it's booked I'm rescheduling my trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: leestogo
Reviews.Content: We had four rooms at Orchid Key and all were great. The staff was very friendly especially Linda and Brandon. Great breakfast, nice pool, happy hour fun. Would go back and would recommend. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Can I give a higher grade than excellent???? The best!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyBeachcomber
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hundreds of hotels in my life for work, and vacations. The Orchid Key Inn is definately one of the BEST!!!!!! We made our decision based on reviews here on TA. Glad we did. You are welcomed with the first phone call, and treated right the moment you arrive. It is a small, friendly inn, recently renovated, and beautifully decorated. Clean as a whistle. Great comfortable beds, with modern bathrooms. Check out all the photos here on TA. Loved the pool and hot tub too. Good location on the quiet end of Duval. You can meet fellow travellers during the provided breakfast, and happy hour. Thanks to Jack and Brandon. The Orchid Key Inn helped make our vacation a great one!!!!!!! See you on the next trip. Cheers-------- Ken

Reviews.Title: “The Orchid Key Inn has great character and is well appointed.”
Reviews.Author: jmsimpson2665
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend at the Orchid Key Inn and we would recommend this treasure on Key West to anyone. This was our first visit to Key West and we really didn't have any idea what we wanted to see and do and the very helpful staff provided us with many options based on our preferences. We were thrilled with the service, cleanliness, amenities, and the wonderful people. It was close enough to the night life to walk, but far enough away to be quiet and peaceful. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hate to reveal best-kept secret of Key West!”
Reviews.Author: 2ForksInTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Even though our stay at the Orchid Key was several months ago, it is necessary to submit this review based on the "staying power" of the memories from our absolutely perfect experience. As other reviewers have stated, we hesitate to reveal this hidden gem, but we can't find a single fault with O/Key...even the pre-dawn rooster concert added to the quirky charm of the Key West experience. Brandon was THE BEST...his recommendations for meals and entertainment were always perfect for us. I think we'd buy real estate in the middle of the Everglades if he was promoting it!! The breakfast was simple and just what we needed to begin our day, and even though the bar wasn't in operating mode when we were there, Brandon directed us across the street to the sister property where we had great fun at happy hour and met new friends. Make sure you pop in at The Keys piano bar for some late night snacks, drinks and great NYC muscians. We went there on our first night, based on Brandon's recommendation, and became a regular for the next 6 nights! Also not to be missed are: Sarabeth's (we went for lunch since we're not big breakfast eaters), Martin's (just down the street from O/Key) for brunch & dinner, and Better Than Sex for the most amazing desserts you will ever experience! This reminiscing makes me want to book another flight to Key West now!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find off TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: HalFlaglerBeach
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is one of the best we have stayed in for a long time. Very relaxing and within walking distance to everything Key West has to offer. The staff was most helpful in recommending restaurants and points of interest. Most of all we want to say cheers to the bartender!!! Happy hour is great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!....afraid everyone else will find out about this gem...”
Reviews.Author: GregGT
Reviews.Content: We chose The Orchid Key Inn solely based upon TripAdvisor reviews for a quick, romantic get-a-way...and since we hadn't stayed there before...we were a little hesitant about the choice...UNTIL we arrived and got to see the location, amenities and meet the staff. We stayed in a King room directly off of the pool area; and had zero complaints. The staff was welcoming, knowledgeable, helpful and fun; the room was perfect in size and more than adequately appointed; the bar/pool area were perfect; parking couldn't be easier; and, the location is ideal for those who want direct access to the action on Duval but desire an intimate escape. We had such a wonderful time. I would feel comfortable recommending The Orchid Key Inn to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fitchfalcon
Reviews.Content: The OKI is a recently remodeled motel, directly on the corner of Duval and Truman. It is in a great location if you are interested in the Duval Shops, bars and restaurants. Not far from Mallory Square either. If you are looking for a quiet tropical resort experience, this is probably not the place for you. But is is a great refuge, close to the action KW has to offer. Stayed in a one-bedroom suite with 20 something adult son, from October 22-26. This was the first weekend of FF, so it was a little crazy out there. Stayed in Key West Marriott in February, my wife and I liked the OKI experience much better. This is much closer to portion of Duval where the nightlife exists in KW, but we felt far enough away to sleep well, which we did. Must be a flat tin roof, though, because rain was a bit noisy one night. This is the quiet side of Duval, in spite of previous reviewer. We noticed almost no noise other than Harleys from the street at all hours and the morning rooster crowing. We were not directly on the street, but were closer to the center of the hotel. Room was nicely appointed, clean and the bed was outstanding....got lost in the King size. CVS is a block away for amenities, snacks, drinks, etc, and all rooms have a refrigerator (we think). Great ice cream/gellato across the street (the one beside Grand Vin, another little wine tasting gem). Tony's Cuban is right in front of hotel and was an excellent spot for cafe con leche (yum!)...didn't try the food there. We were just a couple of blocks from Bahamian Village Goombay for FF with lots of street food, drinks, items for sale, and music....a second line type band procession came by Saturday night also. We had a car, for sightseeing and driving to the wharf for various boating activity mentioned below...parking at $9/day not too bad. Marriott was twice that and you REALLY need a car there because Marriott is really not close or walking distance to anything. Loved the pool/pool area. It was small, but never crowded either, because there are not that many rooms. Evenings at poolside were just as nice, full moon, 70s and a lovely breeze. Marriott pool much bigger, but was full by 11 am most days. Brandon and Jack were both friendly and great at the front desk and have lots of good ideas regarding anything you want to do in the area. We did fishing charter (Brandon recommended great place that would cook our fish, also), snorkling tour, jet ski and parasail. Also got a great recommend from Jack on NFL Sunday (for Pats fans...Lazy Gecco). And we hit Jack Flats on the way down, who also gets the NFL Sunday Ticket Package, we met a lot of fun Ravens fans there celebrating a bachelor party and ran into them all over town the rest of the evening. We didn't spend much time in the hotel bar except for an occasional cocktail and also for breakfast, so can't tell you much about the bartenders. It was usually crowded during HH, so we got drinks and went poolside. Even though continental breakfast is served, we usually just got coffee and then had breakfast on the way to a morning boating activity....several breakfasts near Schooner Wharf (Harpoon Harry's & Pepe's). We would definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but a very noisey motel”
Reviews.Author: steveshannon
Reviews.Content: Location of the Orchid Key Inn is good if you want to sleep on a street...motel is directly on Duval Street. Sounded like we were at truck stop with all of the road noise. Service was good as expected and indicated by the other reviews but all night long we could hear the noise from Duval Street or parking lot. Also motel's parking was directly outside my room's door and could hear car doors closing and engine noise all of the time. Sounded like the cars were driving into my room. Location was good...just not a very relaxing place to stay or sleep at. Up all night so was tired for the day and evening activities. We asked to be moved but other room was much smaller. Also advertized Happy Hour is 1 drink...big dealâ€¦not really a happy hour but the staff was nice and friendly...they make thier money after you get the 1st free drink. So kind of a lost leader in the sales world. Not close to the beaches or ocean...pool is very small and felt like a big spa...too warm, actually felt hot...so wondered how clean and healthy the water really wasâ€¦lots of people and little pool. Staff was very nice but motel is not as pleasant of a place to stay and sleep as indicated by many of the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: amg1015
Reviews.Content: You can't miss at the Orchid Key! Between the perfect location, lush pool and bar area, gorgeous trendy, spa like rooms, happy hour, complimentary breakfasts and great staff, you can't ask for a better place to stay. The layout was done with such care that you forget you are a few short steps from the action on Duval Street. The pool and hot tub areas are beautiful and everything from the room to the parking lot was spotless. The staff was fabulous, giving us great advise on what to see and do....special thanks to Brandon for making our 15th anniversary a night we'll remember for a long time to come and to Jack for steering us in the right direction with great food and activity suggestions. It's a rare to find a place that had absolutely nothing on the negative list. We just got back yesterday and we are already planning our next trip to the Orchid Key

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay right on Duval”
Reviews.Author: unklega
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orchid Key with my girlfriend for three nights in August and we couldn't be happier . The place was recently completely renovated and in tip top condition . The service was great , the amenities were good and the rooms were spotless . The night manager "The Amazing Brandon" was just that as he didn't steer us wrong on anything that we asked him about ! In short I would recommend this tiny hotel to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to book your room here!”
Reviews.Author: Fatcat51
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Key West before at the Hyatt. This place surpassed everything we had experienced previously in every way. Great service, amenities, rooms, robes, breakfast and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Service.”
Reviews.Author: BrandyJack
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 night at this hotel because of Tripadvisor review. All the review are spot on. This place will exceed your every expectation. If you on the fence, book it!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place! Clean, quiet, boutique, great value”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii-Chik
Reviews.Content: I love this place and can't wait to come back! The rooms are super clean and modern. Beds are really comfortable. We stayed in a Jr suite and loved the separate shower, deep jacuzzi tub, even the bath n body works toiletries. The room overlooked the pool, which we used almost every day, and we sat in the hot tub every night. Complimentary happy hour drink every night at 5pm was a welcome bonus, as well as the breakfast (bagels, fruit, yogurt, toast, pastries, etc...) The linens (in room and the pool towels) are quality. Employees really take great care of this place, can't say enough about how friendly and helpful they are!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great safe trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Drobinson281
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed 2 nights at this wonderful hotel. We felt very safe and the rooms were very very nice. The linens on the beds felt like we were on a cruise ship, very nice. The room and all the property was very clean. I would stay here again. Sorry I didnâ€™t get the front desk guyâ€™s name, he was somewhat older then the other 2 guys, but he was very very nice. The lady serving the breakfast was super ! Thank you and we hope to see this hotel again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Small Hotel with Excellent Staff and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: ScottieLover2
Reviews.Content: This lovely small hotel located at the quiet end of Duvall St. in Key West is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The friendly and efficient staff and superior accomodations made our stay both pleasant and pleasurable. The rooms, all located around the pool area, were well appointed with womderfully comfortable mattresses, large showers and large flat screen TVs. The hotel was recently renovated and everything in it is tasteful and beautiful. There is a more than adequate complimentary breakfast each morning and a fun Happy Hour each evening. The area around the pool deck has nice tables and chairs and lounges where guests can mingle and enjoy their breakfast in the morning and drinks in the evening without ever feeling crowded. We were provided with tickets for a comlimentary glass of wine or beer for each night of our stay. The hotel is located very conviently for all restaurants, bars, shops and attractions... all within walking distance. The owners and staff are to be commended for providing their guests with a relaxing and carefree guest experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: LValltheway
Reviews.Content: All of the other rave reviews are on point. The Orchid Key Inn was fabulous. We stayed in a Jr. suite that was impeccably clean and decorated beautifully. I'm contemplating redoing my bathroom to look like theirs. The service was...how can i say it? Perfect! Brandon went above and beyond. Complimentary breakfast and happy hour were a smash. The hotel is in a great location so you're near Duval but not on top of the craziness. We're ready to book again and can't wait to go back. if there are any negative reviews for this hotel/motel, set them aside because they have to be anomalies from people who can never be pleased. If you're looking for a place in Key West to stay that offers it all, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, modern, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: VinodV7
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Orchid Inn was great. Rooms very modern with nice furnishings. Bath & Bodyworks ammenities in the bathroom were great. The bathroom itself was fantastic. Only gripe was that they offered wireless internet but when we called to obtain the password (after the front desk closed) we were told to pay a $50 call-out fee-not impressed. Friendly service, free basic breakfast, nice pool. Just far enough away from the crazy party section to have a good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FABulous. This hotel delivered!”
Reviews.Author: frqntrvlr
Reviews.Content: I canceled another hotel we had booked and changed to the Orchid Key because of the great reviews on trip advisor. This hotel DELIVERED! Perfect location: for our needs, it really was the perfect location. located on Duval a few blocks from the Southernmost point, the hotel was set back enough so you didn't hear all the craziness going on. We were looking for a more relaxing stay (rather than a crazy party) so it was perfect. Easy to walk to lots of good restaurants and shops. A 15 min walk to Mallory Sq. Hotel rooms are updated and clean. Not to mention that the decor adds to the hotel experience of a tropical relaxing vacation. Continental b/fast and happy hour is included and was much appreciated The pool and jacquzzi and all the grounds are very meticulously maintained. The people who run this hotel take such pride in it and it shows. The best part about our stay was the customer service. Brandon and Jack and the rest of the crew were extremely helpful when making all of our plans. I hadn't had time to do a ton of research before this trip so their experience helped tremendously. From booking para sailing, to dinners, etc. Our entire stay was awesome and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful paradise”
Reviews.Author: densol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orchid Inn purely based on the reviews on Tripadvisor - and are so glad we did. This place is absolutely wonderful. Most of the lovely rooms all face the pool. The nice small car park is within the grounds as is the bar. Breakfast which was nice is served from the airconditioned bar in the morning. The happy hour is 4 free drinks per room ( we stayed two nights) Everyone was very friendly and there is a lovely atmosphere in the bar. Brandon was extremely welcoming. The rooms are like WOW !!! Beautiful - cannot fault them - we had a one bed suit and it felt like an apartment ! We travelled with two boys, 11 and 13 and they loved the pool and hot tub. The inn is so well placed - away from the noisy part of Duval street but close enough for easy access to all sights. We will never stay anywhere else in the lovely Key West !

Reviews.Title: “A gem at the quieter end of Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: lin407
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at The Orchid Key Inn. The great reviews are well deserved -- the renovations have transformed this hotel into an small oasis tucked away in a great location. Our room was beautifully decorated and well thought out, with a modern decor. The pool area and bar were adequately sized and lovely. Extra little touches such as bathroom scales, oversized magnifiying mirrors, decorative pillows, IPOD docking station, and outdoor fountains tucked here and there, were plusses. The staff at Orchid Key were very helpful, especially Brandon and Jack. We have one complaint, and hence the four star rating instead of five stars. Even though the rooms are designated as non-smoking, our room (#108) had a strong smell of cigarette smoke, somewhat masked by cleaning products. In hindsight, we should have asked to be moved to a different room. The smell was strong, and when we got home, our luggage, clothes, purses reeked of cigarette smoke. EVERYTHING had to be laundered, and our luggage is still sitting in the garage airing out. I realize that the non-smoking policy cannot be 100% enforced if guests choose to ignore it and be inconsiderate of others. However, this did detract somewhat from our otherwise WONDERFUL experience at Orchid Key Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Orchid Key Inn”
Reviews.Author: MiamiLawGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchid Key Inn for 2 nights in September. The rooms are not large but they are very clean and luxurious. Brandon is the best - he was very accomodating. You are walking distance to mostly everything since you are right on Duval Street. The hotel was pretty full but you did not hear any noise and we slept very well both nights. The bed and linens were very high quality. I woudl def. stay at the Orchid Key Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jess98ac
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Orchid Key last week, and it was FABULOUS. This was our second trip to KW, and we'll definitely stay here again next time. The room was gorgeous, and very clean. The AC worked great, it was HOT last week! We had the pool almost to ourselves for the 2 afternoons we sat by it, and had the hot tub completely to ourselves when we took a soak after walking Duval all day/night. Brandon was super nice and very helpful, he booked a snorkel trip for us. Siobhan and Andrew were also great at the bar. We enjoyed our complimentary drinks each night, plus a few more. The bar is small, but I believe there's talk of expansion....they need it! The word is out, and they get a local crowd along with the hotel guests. The only negative is that if we had been there more than 3 days, I would have definitely gone elsewhere for breakfast a few days. The continental breakfast that was included was certainly adequate, but nothing special. Overall, it was a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Inn, right in the heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Crangelag
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy, the staff made you feel welcome as soon as you stepped in the office. Parking was reasonable, although it would have been nice if it was free, as you really do need to come by car, so parking is a necessity really. The rooms are fabulous and worth the money. Facilities are excellent, and cleanliness was second to none. While we only stayed one night they had no problem with letting us leave our car in the lot for a few extra hours while we went on a trip. I'd definitly stay here again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “truly lovely”
Reviews.Author: sunnyda
Reviews.Content: The Orcjid Key Inn was everything the previous reviews talked about- wonderfully decorated rooms and bathrooms, great linens, outstanding location on Duval Street

Reviews.Title: “BEST Bed & Breakfast in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Ryan1292
Reviews.Content: We stay at this bed and breakfast as our number one choice. The owner Bill and his staff Jose & Brandon are truly the best-The rooms are always immaculate- The staff is very knowledageable -Best place to eat- as well as what to see. My husband and I live in Ft.Lauderdale and get away as many times as possible to reenergize ourselves. We have been going to Key West for 9 years and there is always a new place to eat or something else to see. We never get bored. if Orchid Key Inn is booked - go to their other locatuon- Almond Tree Inn. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “This place has fabulous appointments as well as the type of service that everyone deserves”
Reviews.Author: juliemiller36
Reviews.Content: I'd read the other reviews ahead of time and I was just as pleased with the Orchid Key Inn as I thought I would be. Flawless choices in the rennovations, gorgeous pool area- these types of things can really add to your comfort levels and make a big difference! The customer service is out of this world- always a smiling face with good advice and ideas for enjoying the island. I've stayed at other local B&B's in the area, and this is not always the case. The only reason I cannot give a rating of '5' on the rooms is the sliding doors on the bathrooms- if someone tugs on them just a little too hard they slam shut really hard and the walls at this place aren't exactly thick. You can hear TV's from the rooms next door as well as the slamming bathroom sliders all night long- but for me it really wasn't a deal breaker. It's so relaxing at this place, you'd hardly even notice. Great stay overall. I wish I could go back right NOW!

Reviews.Title: “Just the best and nicest value on the Island!”
Reviews.Author: Gentle_heart
Reviews.Content: When I first saw this place I thought - Okay, nice and tidy little motel. THEN I got inside my room and did a double take. My gosh, this was incredibly nice! Roomy, incredibly comfortable bed, just stunning bathroom, terrific TV. And for the price?!?! No way am I going anywhere else on Key West! Oh yes, and a terrific bar with truly reasonable prices. Just bear in mind, only the house wine / beer is available for the "free" drink. Others are half price, and more complicated drinks like pina coladas are full price. Nonetheless, a terrific bartender, and good drinks. You will not be disappointed! And I would be remiss not to mention that the staff are always most helpful. And this place is walking distance to just everything. Only needed a taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the details and the service”
Reviews.Author: 1MarcoH
Reviews.Content: Went for 2 nights with my wife after reading good reviews on this place. Walking up to it, doesn't look so special. However, once you are in the room, you see the attention to detail that makes it a quality place. The rooms are small, but very clean and modern. We absolutely loved the bar in the converted poolhouse. Mingled with many of the guests there and the bartender's (Hi Siobhan!) friends came by often and provided us with great stories and recommendations. It rained almost the entire time we were in Key West, but we still had a fabulous time. I attribute much of that to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very cool niche inn with resort sized service!”
Reviews.Author: danielleginn
Reviews.Content: We had a blast staying at the Orchid Key. Brandon's recs were spot on and we loved mingling with the other guests at happy hour. One of those places where the guests seemed like minded and we just seemed to click with everyone... Location was perfect as well. We rented bikes right across the street and could have walked everywhere if it hadn't been so HOT! I <3 the Orchid Key Inn and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Chaseman
Reviews.Content: A truly delightful remodeled quaint 1960â€™s motel. The rooms were very nicely appointed with desk, refrig, flatscreen and a nice bath with granite and tile and large shower. Staff is VERY accommodating. Pool was delightfully comfortable and there is a pool bar in the afternoons. The hotel is located right on Deval Street the main street in Key West. Great location, about a 10 minute walk to the â€œsouthern most monumentâ€� in one direction and about a 15 minute walk to the gulf end of Deval. Venture off Deval for food and drink as prices are much better. Bobalus has great Conch fritters and for a very high end dinner go to Louieâ€™s backyard. Rent an electric golf cart across the street from the hotel for $80 for 3 hours and tour the island and its architecture. The hotel is 1 block from Hemmingwayâ€™s home. Caution, some bicycle taxi guys will rip you off if you do not ask the price to your destination before getting onboard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: RoziNy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were only supposed to stay 2 nights, but extended our stay for another night. This place is located right on Duval street, although in a quieter part of town. It is within walking distance of either side of the island, north or south. It is a very updated, chic version of the old school motel. The rooms might be a little tiny, but they are very nicely decorated, and very clean. The bathroom is roomy and very clean. Bath and Body shop products add a nice touch, as do the nice flat screen tv, and bathrobes. Continental breakfast and a free drink for happy hour....what more can you want? Oh...wait....a great concierge too. Don't forget to ask Brandon where to go, what to do, and what to eat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place on Duval but Quiet!!!”
Reviews.Author: rskill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orchid Key Inn for two nights this past week and enjoyed our stay! The rooms were very nicely renovated with great decorations, good use of space, wonderful bathroom, comfy bed, nice (large) tv, and were very clean!!! The room was a little small but wasn't a concern for us. Typically when people say small room it evokes images of a tiny bed, no storage or amenities, and a little bathroom but this is NOT the case here. The King sized room we booked had a large king bed, armoire, mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, i-pod dock, alarm clock, bath & body works soaps, shampoos, conditioners, and lotions, hair dryer, and more! The hotel also offers parking on site for $8/day and they recommended a bike rental place across the street for day trips (or longer if you'd like). (Parking elsewhere can be hard to find and pricey.) The pool, bar, and check-in area were all very nice as well. The bar was small and could only accomodate a few guests inside at a time but there is plenty of seating just outside right by the pool! We were given 2 complimentary drink passes for each night we were there to use during the hotels happy hour from 5-7pm. This was a great way to start our night! Breakfast had a good spread and was served out of the bar as well. They served the typical fresh fruit, pastries, juice, coffee, yougart, toast, bagels, and boiled eggs. The Inn was right on Duval street at the corner of Duval and Trueman. It was more in the center of Duval which made it the perfect location for going to either end of the island. There was maybe a 15 min. walk down to locations like Sloppy Joes and Mallory Square and on bikes 1/3 of that time. This did keep the Inn quiet but still close to things to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Brandon is the Best Concierge Ever!”
Reviews.Author: FreshCreamRestaurant
Reviews.Content: Met Brandon while at dinner at nearby 915 Duval Street and he was very helpful in setting us up with some of the best attractions in town. Love him! Love the look, feel and amenities at the Orchid Key Inn. Nice job, gang!

Reviews.Title: “Best.Hotel.Ever”
Reviews.Author: Susieq98
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the Orchid Key Inn this morning and I must say we really enjoyed our stay. I researched hotels for weeks before I chose this one, based mostly on Trip Advisor reviews, and I was not disappointed at all. It is a wonderful combination of Old Florida and New Chic. The furnishings are stylish (whoever decorated the place has better taste than me!); the bedding and linens are sumptious, great Bath and Body Works gels and shampoos; two large flat screen TVs (we had a King Suite) and a perfect location at the end of Duval. Close to everything but quiet at night. I absolute LOVED the bathrooms. Such luxury! The pool was small but warm and never crowded or noisy. The OKI offers a nice continental breakfast in the morning in the Orchid Bar which we didn't know about until we smelled the coffee. We ate poolside - just lovely! Every member of the staff was laid back and helpful. We loved Key West and will stay at the OKI the next time we go back.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: artrocks
Reviews.Content: This is the coolest, cleanest, comfiest motel in the keys. It's old Florida architecture with all modern upgrades. The location is perfect. The staff is great. There is a very cool diner across the street. I would stay here again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT - Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: iflores1102
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked in mid July and I must say we absolutely couldn't have made a better choice. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by Sean at front desk. He was great at handling our check-in. Sean, answered all of our questions and even recommended some of the best places to wine and dine. He even gave us coupons that were really handy. THANK YOU SEAN!! We booked the King Suite and my husband and I were really impressed with the details such as the bath robes for two, spa quality bath amenities (Bath & Body Works). The room also included other amenities such as i-Home I-Pod radio, safe, mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker and more. The A/C comes with climate control and it worked wonderfully not to mentioned very quiet. At the bar we met our bartender (Shioban) very nice lady who made us laugh. We went there for our complimentary drinks which is served daily from 5 to 6 pm and it was just nice the setting and all. After 6, drinks are at half price which is good. This hotel is close to all the action that Key West has to offer but also allows the coziness and alone time to share with your partner. You will find a Denny's Restaurant open 24 hrs right in the corner and not to far you will also find great rentals on scooters. We will definately be coming back again. Thank you all for making our stay something to remember. Sincerely, Mr. and Mrs. Flores

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: kokanee97
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to the Orchid Key Inn. What made us come back? In addition to the rooms, location, price and the best happy hour in town....the Orchid Key employs the BEST staff. From the "mythical" Brandon - what an outstanding representative for the Inn, to bartenders Daniel and Meghan, my husband and I had a hard time leaving the Inn. Their advice on attractions, restaurants, etc were top notch. Can't wait for our next trip to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and great place”
Reviews.Author: remnam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Inn for 2 nites. The staff is great, the place was super clean and modern. The location is perfect. It is right in the middle of town, right on Duval Street, less than a block from the lighthouse, just up the from everything. We knew parking was a problem, so being in the center of town and walking to everything was easy. A few times we took a taxi because of the heat, but it was still great. Amenities are great here and the bar and pool are a nice treat. Beds were some of the best ever, rooms nice and large and newly remodeled. We stayed in the king suite and it couldn't have been much better. If you want a little more room than a typical B&B, a little more quiet and privacy than a typical B&B, and something more modern than a typical B&B, then you should think about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Clean, Beautiful & Worth Every Penny!”
Reviews.Author: Lustchos
Reviews.Content: Wonderful! The Hotel is even more beautiful than displayed on the website. The room was clean and all the services were above and beyond all my expectation. We stayed in the King Deluxe Suite it was like staying in a spacious two bedroom apartment. There were a King size bed in the bedroom, but you also get the luxury of a Queen Size Sofa bed in the living room. The Hotel is in a quiet area, but still close enough where all the actions on Duval Street are in walking distance. My girls and I enjoyed the Hotel being close to Site Seeing, Shopping and Dinning. The pool was clean and the hot tub was just beautiful, accented by a waterfall. The happy hour offered by the Hotel was in a fabulous setting. The Continental breakfast by the pool is a fantastic way to start each morning. My girls and I enjoyed all the outstanding amenities at the hotel. Anyone planning a trip to Key West, FL should give this hotel a try. It will be money well spend. For my girls and me it was an experience like no other hotel we have stayed at before.

Reviews.Title: “Orchid Key”
Reviews.Author: our_mann
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Orchid Key Inn, .It was very clean, nicely designed and decorated. It was off Duval enough for quiet but close enought to easily walk to the Duval action. The pool was nice. The employees were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Chill Out”
Reviews.Author: AquaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orchid Key Inn over Memorial Day. A short trip (just 4 nights) but very relaxing. The Inn is a single-story, recently renovated motel, but the renovation was done very nicely with pleasing retro style. Glass tiles in bathroom, marble, nice colors, furniture, art, etc. Nice amenities like robes in the room, a free in-room safe and mini-fridge, coffee maker. Everything brand new, sparkling clean and perfectly maintained. Great service by the pool. If you are lucky to be there when she is on, Siobhan will take care of you wonderfully, bringing you refreshments like a watermelon daquri cooler (yum) ! Just grab a comfy lounge chair, order a tropical blender drink and feel the stress of daily life melt away. Pool is not huge (most Key West pools are not) but it is big enough to go for a refreshing dip when it gets too hot, or good to lounge around on the wide steps in the shallow end. Pool is warm, not too chilly. There is also a nice jacuzzi whirlpool/spa with a waterfall feature, very relaxing. Grounds nicely landscaped with pleasant tropical feel. Tables with unbrelllas surround the pool area. Satisfying breakfast included with fruits, cereal, bagels, toast, english muffins, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, juice, coffee, tea and pastries. Happy hour includes a free first drink and snacks, and discounted subsequent drinks. If you get lazy and just want to chill by the pool, you can order lunch delivered from a choice of nearby restaurants. We did this one day and it was great! Hotel is walking distance to many attractions (lighthouse, butterfly garden, beach) and many nice restaurants. We parked upon arrival and did not use the car until we left. Cabs are abundant and not too expensive. Guests are mostly upscale couples (of all types). No kids at all while we were there which we were happy about (peace and quiet at the pool all day) All in all good value for the money in Key West. Highly Recommend this place (and I am picky). See Brandon at the front desk for restaurant and tour recommendations, he is very nice and gives great advice. Great staff, very friendly and welcoming. They treat you right. If you want a great Key West getaway with no stress or problems, stay here. Only suggestion for improvement would be to use disinfectant/room freshener that is less strong, or more "green" . Our room smelled kind of chemically, curiously like horseradish, and the odor lingered in our clothes after we got home. It was not a big deal, but was noticable. A small blemish on an otherwise perfect stay. Recommend if you stay here you go see the butterfly garden 2 blocks away,even if you think it will be corny or cheezy - it is not, it is acually surprisingly beautiful and quite relaxing. I have been to several of these and this was the best I've seen. It was much more enjoyable than we expected.Not just for kids/famlies.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT KEY WEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: benj3_10
Reviews.Content: Orchid Key Inn is a treasure. This is a quaint hotel with updated rooms in a trendy pleasant beachy style. Cleanliness is a top priority here. Everything is in walking distance. The complimentary happy hour is much fun. Breakfast is adequate. There are complimetary plush towels located poolside. Parking is $8 a night, which wasn't well advertised, but wasn't an issue. We highly recommend this hotel and will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of The Best”
Reviews.Author: Goldie246
Reviews.Content: "Wow" what an experience!!!!!!! "A Luxurious Piece of Heaven on Earth." That is how we describe Orchid Key Inn My husband and I traveled to Key West for a four night visit and booked a room at the Orchid Key Inn in Key West. We chose the hotel from the positive reviews on the Internet but our stay was even better than anything anyone had previously posted. The outside temperature was in the high 90's but our room was the perfect coolness we desired. The efficiency of the air conditioning was nothing compared to the staff. There is a bar on premises that is beyond delightful, opening to the pool. It is also where the complimentary breakfast is served daily. The drinks were wonderful, hugh, unbelievable affordable and the perfection of the bartender is beyond words. She knew how to make any drink and no matter what we threw at her, she fulfilled. The wine list is extensive with wonderfully affordable wines. The Inn is located in the most perfect location in Key West, on Duval St. and Truman, and is walking distance to absolutely everywhere. The palms and greenery on the grounds are intermingled with flowing fountains and little alcove seating areas. The rooms are gorgeous with luxury bedding and perfectly comfortable beds The marble bathrooms are filled with amenities and the shower is hugh and each room is eqluiped with a 42" plasma TV. I understand the suites have two 42" plasma TVs in each. The rooms have the most incredible sound proofing I have ever known. You can hear nothing from the outside or any other room. The free WiFi and parking were just additional pluses. The staff will help you with anything and everything you need. I have never recommended any place I have ever stayed higher than I do the Orchid Key Inn. Have fun if you go! We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: edmasbetsy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Good location. Friendly staff/bartenders, fun happy hour, great breakfast, beautiful pool w/comfortable chairs & some spots with shade, room was clean, quiet. Bathroom was awesome w/granite shower and fluffy towels. One of the nicest places I have ever stayed in, I thought the cost was reasonable, cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Once Again”
Reviews.Author: Plaxa
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time staying at the Orchid Key Inn and once again, it was perfect. Upon checking in they informed me the Orchid Bar was now open full service and for the quaint happy hour, that made the trip even better. The staff was of course ever so helpful ecspecially Sean at the front desk and Linda who took care of my room daily. This place is truly top notch. I will return time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Though quite a walk from the action.”
Reviews.Author: gonromin
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Most rooms suround pool which is all but ok. Our room was spacious, clean and cool. You get a continental style breakfast and vouchers for a free drink between 5 & 6pm at the small bar. Everyone is very friendly and helpfull, especially Brendan who advised us the best place to eat. He wasn't wrong! The only 'gripe' I had is that if you want to be at the top end on Duval Street, where the bars, restaurants are, it is at least a 20 min walk. But you could always rent a cycle. Or take a cab! All in all, a very pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: BamaG-Mon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orchid Key Inn from May 17th to May 23rd. This was by far our best hotel experience ever. We read all the reviews on Trip Advisor and felt this was our best choice. We were not wrong. The hotel itself was great. Very clean and comfortable. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Especially Brandon. We had read what a great guy he is and the reviews weren't wrong. Brandon was so helpful with places to eat and things to do. He arranged our sunset sail with Danger Charters for us. He is so passionate about his home and it's preservation. Thanks Brandon for making our stay even better. The bar had only been open a few weeks when we stayed there. Siobhan, the bar manager, was fantastic. We spend several evening just talking to her in the bar. She seemed like an old friend. The Happy Hour was changed our last day there, to one free drink, from 5:00 to 6:00 and 1/2 price drinks from 5:00 to 7:00, but still a good deal. All of the other staff at the hotel were also great. The location is good. It's bit of a walk to the Mallory Square area (but doable), but I like being on the quieter end of Duvall Street. We weren't there during any special events, so all in all it seemed quiet to us. If we're ever able to get back to Key West, we won't have to look for a place to stay. This is IT!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SunsetGirl157
Reviews.Content: Our vacation was fantastic thanks to the Orchid Key Inn. The rooms were so comfortable and luxerious. Brando's recommendations for restaurants and things to do in Key West were fabulous. Ask him about the Half Shell!!! We are already planning our trip next year. You won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay for our one year anniversary”
Reviews.Author: MerriNH09
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a clean and comfy place to stay on Duval Street for a decent price. What we got was a sanctuary with great hospitality, thanks to Brandon and Miss Chevonne (the lovely bartender). You can either walk or rent a bike to get almost anywhere you want on the Island. Between meeting new friends "What's up NY and Tampa!!!!", happy hour, the continental breakfast and helpful recommendations from everyone, we had a blast. We already want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Florida Girl Finds Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Zephyer
Reviews.Content: I choose Orchid Key based on the Trip Advisor reviews. This place is fabulous! Went to KW for seven days to celebrate husbandâ€™s 50th bday. We had considered the Caribbean, but with teenagers at home decided to stay in the state, and glad we did. Canâ€™t think of when weâ€™ve been more relaxed â€“ rented bikes for the entire week and parked car except to meet with our boat captain for fishing and to meet with Meghan at SUP Key West. (Stand up paddle boarding; itâ€™s the best bargain on KW) Rooms â€“ Super clean and modern. We actually slept one morning until 10am, and no, it wasnâ€™t from partying too much the night before! Service â€“ Really made to feel like we were the only guests to take care of, even though hotel was full. There are not enough words to express the graciousness of Brandon. (My sister-in-law called the hotel and asked them to deliver a gift basket for my husbandâ€™s bday; Brandon personally went out and purchased the items!) Bar/Pool- Siobhan (hope I spelled that correctly) is a great bartender. Her drinks were so tasty that I didnâ€™t want to drink anywhere else in KW. The happy hour is a nice touch. Pool was the perfect place to hang in the afternoons. Both Brandon and Siobhan recommend restaurants and we ate like kings! The hotel is unassuming from the front, since the pool is hidden in the back of the property, and the rooms have been completely updated. Weâ€™re all ready talking about a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Heather37
Reviews.Content: We are so thrilled that we chose the OK for our wedding group last month. I was nervous to have chosen a hotel for everyone sight unseen, but WOW! They treated us like royalty! It truly is a beautiful oasis on Duval with everything we needed. The rooms were impeccably clean throughout the entire stay and so, so comfortable. The shining star of this hotel truly is Brandon - not only is he a great resource for all of your KW questions and recommendations, but he's a great personality whom we missed as soon as we left. Thank you for everything, Brandon! As soon as we arrived at our honeymoon hotel, we wished we were back at the OK! We really can't wait to get back....especially since the pool bar opened right after we left!

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly pleasant”
Reviews.Author: CandT2010
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden secret. Great location at Truman and Duval. It must have been recently updated. The outside looks simple, with white brick walls. But, the rooms were amazing with beautiful scenic artwork and updated bathrooms and furniture. The pool was small, but quiet. The hot tub has a beautiful tiled orchid waterfall wall. The lobby attendant was very helpful. The room comes with an adequate continental breakfast in the small bar room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TKSunshine
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Orchid Key and we loved it! Our group took up 5 rooms and every room was clean and beautifully decorated. Brandon was wonderful and attentive even getting some of the ladies a drink while they were in the pool! The Bartender was more than you could ask for, friendly and outgoing with great stories that can keep you sipping fabulous wine all night! The breakfast and free happy hour are a great addition and a relaxing way to start that day and get ready for your evening. We were sad to leave but will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place, clean, updated and very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: SUNFUN39
Reviews.Content: Went to KW for a 5 day trip to relax and unwind. I have been traveling to KW for 15 years and have stayed in many different resorts, hotels and condos. I even own a timeshare there. This past trip we stayed at the Orchid Key Inn. I loved it! I am a very picky traveler often finding many things to complain about. I couldn't find one thing I could complain about. The room was spotless. Comfy bed, great thick bath towels, nice robes! The pool was clean. The staff was super nice and the breakfast and happy hour was a very nice bonus! The location is central to everything we wanted to do. Would definately recommend this place to friends and I would without a doubt stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: cjhennessy3
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Orchid Key Inn and they really deliver. If you are visiting Key West we Highly Recommend that you choose the Orchid Key Inn for your stay. The rooms are wonderful, from the spacious shower to the super comfortable beds with pillows to die for. The rooms are very tastefully decorated in a sleek modern art deco style. Rooms are cleaned daily and the staff does a wonderful job making sure they are spotless. The desk staff and bartender are both extremely friendly. It has a very personal atmosphere. The location is perfect, close to everything. This is the "only" place we will stay while visiting Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning to go back - Orchid Key Inn is the best!”
Reviews.Author: slickllh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed only two nights (sadly!) at the Orchid Key Inn in late April. it was our first trip to Key West, and we are talking about making it at least an annual occurrence. We arrived very early on a Monday, well before check-in time - and Jack assisted us. While they didn't have any rooms ready, he gave us a parking pass for the car and we were told to check back around noon. We took the time to walk up Duval Street a bit and ducked into Willie T's just before a big downpour. Jack called us on our cell shortly after noon to let us know the room was ready. We were put in room 107, facing the courtyard and pool. Everything was spotless and beautifully decorated. The bed was very cozy. The pool was perfect and the courtyard was totally relaxing. Luckily for us, the hotel bar had finally just opened the week before, so we had free happy hour every day and met the bartender Siobhan - she's fabulous! Great drinks and great stories. She sent us to a couple great spots for lunch and dinner, places we never would have found on our own. The free breakfast in the morning was also really nice. I will admit, it is a bit of a hefty walk down to Mallory Square and the busy end of Duval, but being a New Yorker, I'm used to the walking. I honestly can't think of anything bad about this place. I'm not sure why you'd stay anywhere else for the price and value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations in central area”
Reviews.Author: Skyesmom3
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on other trip advisor comments and am very glad I did! I believe this is a new hotel or was just renovated. It is very clean and chic. A lot of other inns in the area look pretty run down. It is centrally located on Duval St which is basically the main strip where all of the bars, restaurants and shops are. It's a little bit of a walk to Mallory Square (15-20 min) but you can take a bike taxi-very interesting...! Overall this is a great place for singles, couples, groups of friends, anyone who wants clean accomodations without spending $300-400 night. We paid $199 and it included breakfast! so, one other thing I definitly suggest doing while in Key West is a jet ski tour with Barefoot Billys. He took us around the island and we had dolphins swimming all around us, it was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “By far, our best stay in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyday85
Reviews.Content: Brandon so matter-of-factly summed it up for us, the day before we departed, by simply saying "Our guests are our friends." We booked the Orchid Key, based upon the great reviews on TA. This was about our 10th visit to KW. We have never stayed the same place twice, but that will end. Our 1st several trips to KW were spent at the large upscale resorts, like the Pier House. The last 3 trips though, we have gravitated to B&B's and have found that they are wonderful in KW. The Orchid Key was no exception to that fact, in all certainty, it was the best place we have stayed there. We stayed during the Song Writers Festival and from the moment we checked in, Brandon's reputation on TA was upheld...he quickly offered to print out schedules, etc. on venues all over town. He was fantastic our entire stay! Let's move on to Siobhan. We arrived 2 days after the Orchid Key Bar opened. Siobhan was undoubtedly the friendliest, most attentive bar tender anywhere we have EVER been. She was a pleasure to be around and her creative cocktails never disappointed! (I think we were guinea pigs for her Cucumber-Watermelon Martinis...FANTASTIC!) We stayed in a 1 BR Suite, which was very nicely appointed, roomy, quiet, very clean, and had extremely comfortable bedding. The included breakfast was much more than the usual "Continental" style...just perfect...why would you want to go anywhere else for breakfast?? Thanks to Brandon and Siobhan for making our short 3-night stay extremely memorable! Hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Heike31
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was wonderful. Very clean, a great bathroom, and a bed that you melt into every night. All of the rooms are situated around the pool area which also now has a bar. I enjoyed a strawberry banana pina colada a few times as i layed out by the pool. Siobhan is a wonderful, wonderful person, and she has great stories to tell! Makes pretty good drinks too! Brandon was a big help in where to go to eat a great meal! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. For the price (which is pretty reasonable compared to some other places) you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Orchid Key (especially Brandon and Siobhan)”
Reviews.Author: SulaHula
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fantastic week at the Orchid Key. We really lucked out because it was the first day the pool bar opened (after not having a liquor license for over a year). The new bartender (Siobhan) rocks! Loved her!!! The rooms are nice and clean and pretty soundproof. You can sometimes hear the chickens, but I did not feel they were loud enough to wake me. Brandon is quite the host, unlike Jack who was working when Brandon was not. We asked if he could print out our boarding passes for us, but he said no it would mess with the computer system there. When Brandon came later that day, he seemed to have no problem doing it for us. Brandon and Siobhan, the Jersey Kids (Rooms 104 & 105) will miss you. Hopefully we'll see you soon! Stay well and happy! :-)

Reviews.Title: “our new annual girls weekend hotel”
Reviews.Author: kestrobel
Reviews.Content: my twin sister and i have been planning a trip to KW for over 10 years. with life passing us by and 2 kids later, we decided to finally bite the bullet and get away for a few days without the kids for a girls trip over our 34th birthday weekend! i used to go to KW when the Orchid was NOT the Orchid. wow...what a difference!!! it has been beautifully renovated and was so clean! we especially loved the little alcoves with the tables and chairs and fountains to just hang out in! but our favorite part of our stay there was BRANDON!!! what a great, great, great person! the hotel would not be the same without him! he was very friendly and extremely helpful! (hope to see you next year brandon!!) we got a great rate, for a great room and great service. we will definitely be repeat customers!!! the bed was super comfy and the shower was amazing! only drawback was the rooster, who seemed to be an all-night party animal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, clean, oh so clean.”
Reviews.Author: enchilada72
Reviews.Content: Did I mention clean? My hubby and I have traveled quite a bit and stayed in some beautiful hotels and some not too nice. It was so clean I thought we could be the first clients using our room since the renovation. That is how clean it was. It looked exactly like the Hotel photos on the online travel website pages. This is one at the top of my list. It was just so clean! From the moment I stepped in I felt like I was at a spa. I have read some reviews that say the rooms are small. We had the king deluxe and it was enough space for the 2 of us. We had a huge bathroom and again, it was so clean. They had wonderful thick robes and very luxurious towels. After a day out in the sun it was nice to come back to a cool and comfy room. The fridge did freeze some of our drinks, but again, after a day in the sun a Diet Coke slushee was delish! We had no trouble finding a good place to eat and drink as we were in the middle of Duval. Yet the minute we walked up the drive it was very quiet and relaxing. Yes, the breakfast they serve is very basic, but for my husband and I, it was perfect. I would go out to the Orchid Bar and pick up something for the both of us and we would have a breakfast in bed while planning the day. Parking in the area was horrendous, so it was nice to park at the Inn (for $8/day) and just walk everywhere. It is well worth the money. The folks at the front office were very nice and helpful. Not sure if any of them were the Infamous Brandon that other reviewers have mentioned, but they were all nice and helpful. To be totally honest, the Keys were OK. But staying at the Orchid Key Inn made it memorable. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Did I mention how clean it was?!?!?

Reviews.Title: “Unique treasure”
Reviews.Author: Tchwawa
Reviews.Content: We happened upon Orchid Key Inn as we needed only one night before our bed & breakfast was available to us. What a WONDERFUL place. The room was so comfortable and beautiful...the staff were all friendly and helpful. We were very impressed and would stay here again in a heartbeat. Although directly on Duval Street, this Inn manages to keep a very quiet profile and we enjoyed a lovely quiet evening with a stroll down Duval and back home for the night. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis on Key West's main drag”
Reviews.Author: Hello2World
Reviews.Content: Orchid Key Inn is right on Duval Street yet feels quiet and cosy. The motel has been beautifully refurbished. The room was lovely and comfortable and the bathroom was luxurious. However, our room was very small and dark. I wake up before my husband and there was nowhere to sit and turn on a light without disturbing him. Breakfast was served outdoors and we hit some cool weather so it was uncomfortable. Service otherwise was fine. We got good advice on restaurants and a sunset cruise. There are many restaurants within a few blocks and many bars to the north and galleries to the south of the inn. I would stay here again only if a larger room is available.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: davidrapaport
Reviews.Content: Very elegant and modern motel room with separate lounge area and separate toilet, shower only but very nice bathroom area. Good breakfast selection by the pool which was a very pleasant splash pool good for children and sunbathing in relaxing area. Pleasant staff and a very good position to explore main areas of Key West,

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: brothers7
Reviews.Content: We took the ferry from Ft. Meyers in the pouring rain and I was so excited to get to the Orchid Key based on the photos on the website. I was a bit taken aback when we first drove up. However, once in the rooms I was most definitely pleased. Everything in the hotel, and I mean everything has been redone to the nines! Marble and granite everywhere. Seperate shower and toilet area. Gorgeous linens and bathrobes. The place was immaculate and I was most pleased. We are from Chicago and because of that we are accustomed to the very best that travel has to offer. By far however, the best part of this hotel is the front desk person, Brandon. I do a great deal of traveling and Brandon is without a doubt the consummate professional who also offered such a genuine, personal touch. He's hilarious on top of it! I generally don't like to go back to places I've already been, but I would go back to Key West and the ONLY place I'd stay is Orchid Key because of Brandon!

Reviews.Title: “We would not hesitate to stay at the Orchid Key Inn again... we wouldn't consider any other location”
Reviews.Author: LoriCLM
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Orchid Key was relaxing and truly enjoyable. The room was newly renovated and the king size bed offered the most peaceful sleep of our vacation. I loved the shower and the entire bathroom set up and design. Our room looked out at the pool and although the temperature was a little cool.... the pool side loungers were fantastic and the hot tub was enjoyable before ending the day. The quaintness of the Orchid Key was perfect and cleanliness was top notch. The entire staff was not only helpful, but genuinely were interested in making sure the guests of this property enjoyed not only their stay at the Orchid Key ... but in Key West. Customer service is #1 in this industry, and as I am involved in the industry I have to let the the owners of this property know that Brandon and the other staff, are probably the major reason for their success. The location is perfect, the amenities are excellent, the value is worthwhile and it is nicely bundled together by having employees that are hospitable, professional, caring, knowledgeable, and eager to be involved with the success of the business. The Orchid Key is a rare find in todays travels.... you need to add it to your itinerary in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room”
Reviews.Author: spietrowski
Reviews.Content: For our yearly trip, we decided to try the Orchid Key Inn after having seen that the renovations were complete last year. We were very happy with the room and location. The bed was super comfortable. The room was very clean. The only drawback was a rooster who seemed to think that 3am was a good time to start his crowing - there isn't much you can do about that though. We will most likely stay here next year as well.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Jerandder
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first stay in Key West. We wanted a place with charm, but modern amenities. And this is just what we got. Most of the rooms are situated around a lovely pool area. We did make some use of the pool and lounges. The breakfast is served in this area, and it was relaxing starting our day here. Many choices for breakfast, including different breads, spreads, yogurt, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs. Being that we were staying almost a full week, we were given the offer of letting them know if we had any special requests. We did not take advantage of this offer, but it was much appreciated, anyway. Coffee could be stronger! Afternoon wine and snacks at Almond Tree down the street was nothing great. Only went one time. We stayed in a King suite and it was very large and well-appointed. Very clean. As one other reviewer mentioned, upon entering the room, there was a strong cleaning solution odor, but this dissipated quickly, and I actually forgot about it unitl I read the other review just now. The bed was really comfortable and the blackout shades worked perfectly. One minor issue; there was no clock in the bedroom! Small inconvenience. And again, as others have mentioned, crowing roosters abound and tend to wake the lighter sleepers at around 5AM. Can't really avoid this Key West idiosyncracy! Noise from the street was negligible. Location was great, but a little far to walk to some locations. We walked to beach at Ft. Zach, but were so thankful to have caught a pedi-cab by chance on the way back. Also walked to Mallory Sq., but again, preferable to get some kind of ride back, depending on how tired your legs are! Brandon was super and we enjoyed getting to know him. He steered us in the right direction for activities and made the reservations for us. Fishing on the Gulfstream IV, and sunset cruise on Danger Charters, not to be missed. Two of the highlights of our trip. If you want to keep your catch and have it prepared at a local restaurant, it is not as easy as some would have you believe. We found Dante's in the historic marina will do it. I would suggest at least one meal at El Siboney (cuban) and surprisingly good roast pork at Rumba's on Duval. Overall, it was a great trip. If we return to KW, we will most likely stay at the Orchid Key again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MichasUK
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel partly due to the good reviews on tripadvisor. The rooms are very well decorated and the beds are comfortable. The location is also good as it is fairly central. However, this is essentially a renovated motel so don't expect the big reception / lots of staff / facilities etc you would normally get with a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good stay even during spring break”
Reviews.Author: tstall1
Reviews.Content: Centralized located on Duval street..had to move room one night because we received the single room located next to duval street. never made breakfast nor happy hour..very clean rooms, large bathrooms, extremely comfortable bed. had to have our key reprogrammed daily...(one time it was at 4 in the morning) called emergency number and they were there within 10 minutes...bring your walking shoes..15 minute walk to Hogs Breath...10 min to beach..

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy place right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: crazyplatter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my sister in a king room. The room was on the smaller side, but smartly decorated with a comfortable bed. Robes, safe, small fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and large screen flat TV were some of the amenities. The bathroom was large, clean and also well appointed. Parking costs extra ( I think it was $8/day). Staff was friendly. The pool area looked lovely but b/c our time was limited, we didn't swim at all. Next time!
