There's a complimentary happy hour at their sister property about a half block away....nothing special though (budweiser, tostito's!!!) and continental breakfast buffet at the Orchid- many choices, but nothing memorable. I was afraid the location meant the street noise would be too much, but our interior room was quiet. I would stay here again, but wonder if there might be something a little more interesting at a better price, given then plethora of small inns in Key West. Extra tidbits: loved the store Besame Mucho, and the dining at Micheal's.

Reviews.Title: “No kidding!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieOH1
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why I didn't believe all the rave reviews, going in. I think maybe it was because the photo of the Orchid Key sign kind of screams "Motor Court!" Which it is, but in the BEST possible way. A thoughtful, fabulous reno has transformed this inn into an amazing makeover of its original self that pays homage to its origins while providing a near-flawless experience. The pool is gorgeous, the details of the redesign are perfection, the rooms themselves (ours was pretty small) are incredibly comfortable and equipped with every amenity. And, yes, everybody loves Brandon and the rest of the staff are delightful and helpful as well. I'm not sure how the inn can be located right in the middle of Duval, at Truman, no less, and still feel quiet and secluded. Loved it. Totally. If we ever go back to Key West, it'll be our first and only choice. Now, if they could warm up the weather.....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: purplehatartist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the last week of February to get away from the long harsh Midwestern winter. The Inn is just wonderful. The grounds are well kept and beautifully landscaped. Our room, though small, was well laid out and very comfortable. Whoever did the decorating for this boutique inn, knew what they were doing. It has a tropical, modern feel, done very tastefully. The bathroom was large and the shower was huge. Every employee of this inn was helpful and friendly. As others have mentioned, Brandon was super helpful. When we asked for a restaurant recommendation, he not only made a suggestion, but gave us the whole history of the place. Then he (and others also) would reach into their big drawer, pull out a business card for the place, and an offer for a free drink or other discount for the place. The location is perfect for a true taste of Key West. Our last stay, we stayed on the western side, which had luxury hotels on the water and a younger crowd. It was fine, but we felt more at home at the Orchid Key and on the eastern side. Every single place we ate, we enjoyed: Black Fin (red grouper and yellow tail snapper and bananas foster--wow), Abbondanza, Blue Heaven, nine one five were all great. For lunch, the Southernmost Beach Cafe right on the Atlantic is good. The Inn offers breakfast each morning, but one morning we walked to the Flamingo and I had the freshest scrambled eggs. Croissants de France was also good, and their chocolate croissants are a real treat; we stopped and bought some on our way home from the Duvall Crawl one evening. Tried a lot of key lime pie, but my favorite was from the Key Lime Pie Factory--not too sweet, and a traditional crust. The meringue has bits of key lime zest on top--mmmm. And Sunday Champagne brunch at La Te Da is so charming. On the western side, we had a seafood appetizer at the Westin Bistro (Mallory Square) that was huge and juicy. When going to Mallory Square, be sure to check out the guy with the homemade pretzels--AWESOME, and he has 50 different kinds of mustard. Also on that end of the island, try lunch at Sunset Pier; the crispy crab sandwich was yummy. We had a wonderful week and the Orchid Key Inn was a large part of that. It's a quiet place to relax in the morning with breakfast, or take a nap at the pool in the afternoon before heading out later. If you're staying more than a couple days, definitely get one of the suites so you have a place to sit other than the bed. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location on Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: SceneITNOW
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to the action on Duval Street then the Orchid Key Inn is the spot.. Suites are roomy and bed was comfortable. Room had some issues with stained tiles, which we were told they were in the process of replacing in the future. Innkeeper was attentive to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great! The accomodations, the staff and particularly the location!”
Reviews.Author: bigshag
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough of the Orchid Key Inn. If you are in Key West for the night life Duval is the place to be and Orchid Key Inn is easily in walking distance (drunk or sober!)to the night life and the beaches. The Orchid Key Inn is small and quaint. In a previous life it was your typical motorlodge but it has been transformed into beautifully appointed modern accomodations. The heated pool is the central focal point now with a hot tub tucked away in front of the mosaic orchid waterfall. Breakfast in the mornings was really relaxing, sitting around the pool and enjoying the sun and warm weather (we'd come from Maryland where there was still about 18 - 24 inches of snow on the ground!). The rooms were well appointed and the bed was fantastic (not what you find in most hotels). Except for the roosters crowing it was pretty quiet. Outside our rooms we had a small sitting area next to a small fountain. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. They allowed us to use their pool towels to take to the beach. The cocktail hour was moved to their sister hotel the Almond Tree Inn. It was only a few steps down Truman but didn't have seating for all who were there. The price was reasonable in comparison to other locations in the Old Town area. For my money, the Orchid Key Inn had it all. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Orchid Key is 4/5 on its own and Brandon makes it easily 5/5!”
Reviews.Author: TJ2dogs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our honeymoon off at the Orchid Key Inn. We were skeptical at first about Key West in general and also about this hotel, as the room price was much lower than anywhere else. In hindsight, we wish we would have spent our entire honeymoon at the Orchid Key with Brandon! We stayed in the jacuzzi suite and it was fantastic... the bed was plush, decor and furniture artistic and modern, bathroom and amenities were awesome (Bath and Body Works shampoo, etc), and the room was very clean and cozy (no problems with noise at night). As many other reviewers have noted, Brandon was awesome, a huge help, and was absolutely integral to the 5-star rating I have given. It is refreshing to meet someone who genuinely enjoys helping others. Brandon helped us make the most out of our short stay in Key West, including fantastic dinner recommendations and a great kayak recommendation with Lazy Dog kayak tours. Thanks Brandon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: LRKTraveler
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about how pleased we were with our stay at the Orchid Key Inn. This old motorcourt style hotel has been totally renovated and is thoroughly modern. We had a upgraded room with a bedrom and sitting area so I cannot speak for the smaller standard rooms, but our room was very nice with a beautiful bathroom, seperate toilet area, and two flat screen TV's. Staff was top notch and accommodating. Pool and hot tub area was spacious and nice. Breakfast in the mornings was a great thing to have available. Location is perfect - on Duval St but on the quieter less rowdy side, but within walking distance of everything. You won't need a car unless you need a ride to the airport (cab far to airport is $20 for 2 people) or want to take a trip to another Key. Only small disappointment was the happy hour which is held at a neighboring property. For some reason the Orchid Key cannot pour on their property. I hope that they get that together because it would be cool to have the happy hour on-site. This did not diminish our stay though. I would definately stay here again and recommend the Orchid Key. It was well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: JDWI
Reviews.Content: Located right on Duval St. you can walk to almost any place you want to see. Surprisingly quiet (except for the early rooster wake up calls). Very clean and tastefully appointed. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mandm070359
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Orchid Key. We stayed on the recommendations from other trip advisor reviews. The front desk staff were great and extremely helpful in choosing off the beaten track retsaurants and even making our reservations. The breakfast we enjoyed pool side each morning served by the owner himself. The rooms were great - beautifully decorated with a mini fridge, microwave, coffee machine, safe, blow dryer, iron and ironing board. The bed was king size and extremell comfortable.The bathroom was also beautifully decortaed with a great walk in shower. We will definitely stay here again. Everyone at the hotel was extremely courteous, friendly and very helpful. M & M from Toronto

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay but a bit cramped”
Reviews.Author: jujuking
Reviews.Content: Positives: The location: It's right on Duval Street where all the stores and restaurants are but it is away from the noise. Pool: Heated. When we were there, nobody was using it probably because it was chilly. Well groomed grounds: I liked the plants and little fountains. Free breakfast: The food isn't that great and the coffee is eh... but it's free. Bathroom: Love the spa like setting and the huge walk-in shower. I also love the products they use. Bed and pillows: Very plush and comfortable. We didn't hear the adjacent rooms too much so the walls may be thick or perhaps we were just lucky and nobody was staying next to us? Negatives: Room size: It's pretty cramped. Closet: Kind of small and dusty inside.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, terrific front desk personnel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sevengrkids
Reviews.Content: This lovely remodelled inn is just off the noisy part of Duval and is perfect for anybody looking for quality amenities, quiet location and friendly staff. It is about a 15 minute walk to Mallory Square along Duval and right by the trolley stop if you want to tour the town that way. The rooms have all been beautifully upgraded and ours had granite counters, double walk in shower, king size bed with top quality linens. The pool is a nice size with a hot tub. Sean and Brandon at the front desk couldn't do enough for us when it came to recommending restaurants, things to see and do (as well as some to avoid). Thanks to Brandon for recommending Lazy Dog Kayaks as opposed to spending big bucks on a mass kayak tour that we were going to take! This was our first trip to the Keys and won't be our last! We'll defiinitely be coming back to Orchid Inn on our next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: KamperGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Friday night, and picked this property for price, location, and because of the reviews. Rather than the usual B&B type properties of Key West, this has a stylish, modern boutique hotel feel. Yes, the rooms are European in size (very small) and the standard rooms do not even have space for a chair or table. But they are sooo nice, the bed is heavenly and the bathroom was the best of any hotel I have ever stayed! The colors are more of a hint at tropical beach rather than that overdone dated floral of the old hotels. Brandon is as helpful as other reviews have stated. I thought the happy hour (which, yes, is across the street) was a nice addition. The rooms all surround the pool area (so keep your curtains closed), but the pool and hot tub are beautiful and open 24 hours! No one was in the pool at night, and after a night at the bars, we came back to soak in a hottub that we had to ourselves! Breakfast was a nice spread (but not as good as others have said). The hotel is right on Duval Street, has a good amount of parking and is walking distance to all the activity, but far enough to be peaceful at night. This is an old motor lodge place that was redone with really modern details. There was just a feel to the property that I really liked - the bright white exterior, breakfast by the pool, fountains, luxury bed linens, and very clean beautiful bathrooms. If you are a hip modern couple and don't want the florals and lace of the clasic B&B's - this is the property for you!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay, very friendly, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: ghia70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid key inn for 5 nights in October 2009. Great hotel, very clean, management team are very friendly and helpful. Great location for Key west and surrounding areas. Breakfast is very good and complimentary wine/beer in the evening is very welcome. Rooms are very well appointed - very modern and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: gwlutzen
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay away from the end of Duval street where there is lots of comotion. The staff (Brandon) was extremely helpful and reccomended the best resturants to go to, we were never dissapointed with the sugestions. The pool is nice and drowns out the noise from the street. The morning breakfast was great and it's free. There is also a free happy hour every evening where you can load up before you go out. The location was great we could walk just about anywhere we needed to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, But Wasn't Served the Kool-Aid Other Reviewers Had”
Reviews.Author: ElleJayGee
Reviews.Content: As frequent visitors to Key West, we were trying to find a place to stay that wouldnâ€™t break the bank, but still be quiet, and close enough to our favored haunts. The Orchid Key Inn got great reviews, and the price was right, so we decided to check it out. We had an extremely nice stay in a deluxe king room, which had a separate sitting area room with a couch, and a chair, and a second flat screen tv (in addition to the one in the bedroom area). I really liked the nouveau-retro dÃ©cor, although I have to admit I guess I missed some of the more tropical flavor weâ€™d had during previous stays at pricier b&b- type places. There was also a small fridge (which sadly froze all of our beer) and a microwave (which we didnâ€™t use). The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed Iâ€™ve ever slept on--we slept amazingly during our stay. Some of the previous reviewers commented on how small the rooms were, but I canâ€™t say that was an issue at all with ours. So spring for a deluxe if you go. The issues we did have were minor, but still worth mentioning. Housekeeping came wayyyy too early (as others have observed) and there didnâ€™t seem to be any â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� signs. This was kind of annoying, especially after a night of crawling Duval Street, and you knew that knock on the door was coming. We had to ask the front desk for more toilet paper-- housekeeping kept forgetting to refill. Or maybe we just use a lot of toilet paper, I donâ€™t know. Catastrophic? No. Annoying? A little. On the day before we checked out, housekeeping didnâ€™t quite finish making our bed, and left it like that. Again, not a big deal, just kind of odd. The wireless connection was spotty (but the hardwired one in the room worked fine). The roomâ€™s marble floors became an ice skating death rink when we happened to enter after being out in the rain. There were no ceiling fans, which just seemed weird in the tropics, and I would think would ultimately save on cooling costs, since we like it cool when we sleep, and cranked the air to compensate. We had to ask the front desk for towels every time we went to the pool. Why not leave them in the room, or make them available by the pool? The very comfy lounge chairs get roasting hot in the sun, so I had to stand around waiting-- again, minor complaints. And speaking of the office staffâ€¦ We didnâ€™t see the mythic Brandon until checkout, and he was wonderfully friendly, cheerful, and helpful, just as everyone else had pointed out. The rest of the office staff weâ€™d encountered can best be described as â€œcoldly and politely efficientâ€�-- not so unlike the marble floor in our room. Luckily, we knew where we were going and what we were doing, and didnâ€™t really need them. As for the bar not being open, we knew about it beforehand, and made sure to stock the aforementioned beer slushies in our room fridge. We had a wonderful vacation, and didnâ€™t really spend all that much time in the room anyway-- but it was super clean, in a good location, and had the best bed ever. Iâ€™m not sure, though, if we would return-- my husband and I ultimately prefer a place, if possible, with a small private deck or a patio, to sip coffee and read the paper in the morning, and have drinks in the afternoon. But thatâ€™s personal preference, and would not prevent me from recommending the Orchid Key Inn as a very, very good place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharen210
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful visit to Key West. The hotel location was great towards the quiet end of Duval Street.. Brandon was just a sweetheart, very friendly, certainly tried to make your visit comfortable. Rooms were small, with no dresser space but very modern, clean, safe, small refrigerator, nice flat screen TV - definitely would return. A big plus they had parking spaces. I can see why this hotel was rated #1.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: amfortner
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending three nights here and it was great! Will totally stay here again when we go back to Key West! Location: The location is great! The Inn is located about 3 blocks from the bar scene making it peaceful and quiet....very relaxing. You are able to walk to all attractions from the Southern Most Point to the Historic Docks/Mallory Square. There are great restaurants all around....very easy to get around from this location. Property: The property is beautiful and well kept. Very modern/retro. The pool area is comfortable with plenty of seating and lounge chairs. We enjoyed Happy Hour at their sister hotel across the street which was nice. Breakfast had a very good variety to meet everyone's needs. Rooms: Wow!!!! The rooms are comfortbale and clean. The bathroom is of good size and feels like you just stepped into a spa. Everything is new and modern. You have everything you need to be comfortable in your room including free Wi-Fi, huge flat screen TV, microwave, fridge and an in room safe. Staff: The staff was great! Brandon....you rock!!!!! Dinner recommendations? Ask Brandon....he'll even make the reservations for you. Things to do? Ask Brandon. Brandon is in the know! Anything you may need, just ask....the staff will point you in the right direction. Thanks again for everything! The Fortners'

Reviews.Title: “Skeptical going in . . . happily exceeded all our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: PJDJGoodTimes
Reviews.Content: Right from the 'get-go,' this place stands apart. The area location is ideal. Quiet, but close to everything. After being pleasantly greeted, we were shown to our fabulous room! Clean, way above average decor, and all the amenities; fridge, wide flat screen TV, K-Size Bed to die for, and enough pillows to make a Sheik smile. The pool was pleasantly refreshing, and we especially enjoyed our time in the outdoor jacuzzi. We thought the temp was PERFECT. After a great night's sleep, we were only steps away from the provided healthy breakfast to start our day. Even though the bar wasn't yet open, the complimentary Happy Hour next door sufficed nicely. Although all the staff was accomodating, we have to say Brandon is truely Orchid Key's best asset. Friendly, helpful, & funny . . . he had a big impact on our wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Truly lives up to the great reviews!”
Reviews.Author: beach_blond10
Reviews.Content: How could this hotel possibly live up to our expectations after all the great reviews we read???? It did that and more. Brandon does exist and he is just as wonderful as past guests have mentioned. As frequent travellers to Key West, we have a few favorite spots, but he offered helpful updates and suggestions. The room is beautiful and CLEAN. The bathroom was spotless...and I never say that! Continental breakfast was very nice, plentiful and attended by staff that were truly accomodating. One small note, our Queen room was a bit tight. Of course, we had a ton of luggage and there was no bureau/drawer space. We were fine with it, but you should consider this when choosing your room type! This is an amazing gem at a great price in a perfect location! We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Orchid Key delivered, even if Key West did not!”
Reviews.Author: snakedoc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a shortened stay in Key West and the Orchid Key Inn. The weather was unbearable (40's and windy/rain), really disgusting, but the Orchid Key eased the blow. Location: Couldn't be better. Right on south Duval. A block from the Hemingway House, 3 blocks from the butterfly garden. Across the street from bike, scooter rentals. Great eateries all around, but also a bit away from the bar scene--therefor keeping it quiet when you decide to turn in. We heard nothing from our room. Property: Beautiful. Extremely well appointed. Classy, clean. I imagine there is a great vibe there (when people aren't hiding from the weather in their rooms). Even the deck furniture is classy. Rooms: One word. Amazing. The bed was more comfortable than our very nice bed at home. Nice plasma screen on the wall. The bathroom is amazing and the shower is HUGE! Staff: Brandon truly made us feel at home (and with how bummed out we were by the weather, we needed it a little). We also had to leave 2 days early due to an emergency back home and he was more than accommodating. Great guy. I highly recommend the Orchid Key Inn. We will definitely be staying here the next time we go to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in KW. Reviews do it justice!”
Reviews.Author: Bigjimma
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and found the place to be everything has already said in previous reviews. i have nothing to compare it to in KW but we enjoyed it very much. It is very well located but away from the noisey part of Duval St., clean, well presented, good parking, fast and free Wi-Fi, new TV etc etc. My only citicism would be the maids waking us up anywhere between 9am-10am and because they don't have "do not disturb" signs you can leave on your door. I would also say it is expansive when compared to other "B&B's "but can't speak for how it compares to others in KW. What i do know is that we loved it and it was worth every penny and deserved of the top spot!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Holly088
Reviews.Content: I've been to KW many times previously, mostly camping at Boyd's. This time I wanted to pamper myself and used Trip Advisor to search for a B&B or Inn. The Orchid Key Inn was a #1 pick on Trip Advisor and it definitely turned out that way for me! It's an old (50's/60's?) motel that's been totally updated inside - very spa-like with dark wood, brushed metal, frosted glass, modern art, wonderful robes, etc. And the price was great (especially considering I was there around the holidays). It's on the less-busy end of Duval and the rooms are off the street to reduce noise. That also places you closer to the beaches (Higgs is the best and closest). All the employees were nice but Brandon was the best - friendly, funny, and helpful. They have a pool and hot tub for relaxing after a busy day (temps were in the 70's while I was there in Dec. '09). I rented a bike for the week (with a discount from the Orchid Key Inn) and enjoyed riding almost everywhere (except crazy busy Roosevelt Ave). Do stay here and tell them the cookie lady sent you!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: detroiterchick
Reviews.Content: We booked the Orchid Key Inn, based primarily on review on this website, and they were accurate. The Orchid Key Inn's location is ideal - on Duval St. in the center of Old Town, where all of the action happens. The few extra dollars you may pay for your room will be worth it, particularly because you really won't need a car if the Orchid Key is your home base. The rooms were beautifully renovated and very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and the shower/bathroom was very spacious. The plasma TV was huge and the iPod docking station in the rooms were a plus. While the accommodations were lovely, Brandon, our concierge/manager of the hotel, made our stay incredible. He, along with all of the other staff, was very helpful. He consistently made excellent recommendations on activities, bars and restaurants. My husband and I enjoy experiencing "local" rather than "touristy" attractions when on vacation and he sent us to the best places in town and in many cases, made reservations/accommodations on our behalf. When you are at The Orchid Key Inn, you feel like family. The rooms, location and staff are all amazing - well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: IdleVice
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Key West this year was made more memorable due to the Orchid Key . I understand that the Orchid Key had recently been renovated and, in my opinion, they did everything right. The "spa feel" of the rooms, the pool area, and the Orchid Key Lounge all provided the perfect oasis from the crowds on Duvall. Brandon Morgan was exceptional in the service he provided during our stay. It was a pleasure to see someone who truly cared about the satisfaction of his guests. I will be recommending the Orchid Key Inn to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: munchkin80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Key Inn for a last minute trip to try and meet with a wedding planner, based solely on reviewers recommendation. The room was bigger and nicer than the one I had a Casa Marina last year (and I love that hotel) and not what you expect from the outside appearance (I know there's a life lesson there). The staff, Brandon (who blushed when I mentioned reading all about him) and Jack were great. Brandon recommended a local hair salon for a last minute appointment and I was accommodated immediately. Parking is limited and you are located at the quiet end of Duval Street, so it's easy to park and walk around wherever you need to go. I plan to stay here in the future and I also plan to recommend it for our destination wedding guests next December who are looking for a great find at really reasonable prices!

Reviews.Title: “Nirvana”
Reviews.Author: MS&KHMexicoBeach
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Orchid Key Inn gets a five star rating. The rooms are amazing. The location is perfect. The price is very affordable and then they throw in happy hour and breakfast everyday! Such a deal!! The owner is very hands on and so personable and Brandon, well - Brandon is a doll. He is very helpful with everything that is Key West. We will look forward to returning to our little piece of paradise! Kim & Michael

Reviews.Title: “Good but.....”
Reviews.Author: flmegs
Reviews.Content: I couldn't give it all of five because of a little thing. We stayed in 109 with a jacuzzi tub. I was very excited to use it, but the first night I tried it did not work. I called the front desk and all he said was, Did you fill it past the holes? I did. He informed me that is all he could do tonight and send someone tomorrow. No one came to fix it. Oh well. Oh the Happy Hour was moved to a different place, but wasn't far to walk. Other thaen the tub, happy with my stay. Will go back, but check the tub first.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Orchid Key Inn”
Reviews.Author: R_KinTejas
Reviews.Content: We completely echo mikesluckywife's, INDurham's, and the other positive reviews you'll find here. If you're going to Key West you have to stay here. Yes it is on Duval, but you'll never know it. We'd like to thank Brandon for making our trip all the more special. We'd also like to recommend you take a dolphin tour with Capt. Sheri at Wild About Dolphins - she's extremely knowledgeable and passionate about Dolphins and the Keys. We booked prior to our trip, but the folks at the Orchid Key Inn know her and we're sure they'll be happy to help you arrange a trip with her.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean, convenient, reasonably priced, great helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: AMK02138
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic weekend at Orchid Key!! Brandon was super helpful and friendly...we were only there a few days so we wanted to make sure we knew where to eat and hang out. His restaurant guidance was excellent, we got just what we wanted, and he helped steer us the right way for activities and places to hang out. The hotel is very cute and charming, on the outside, with a very nice quiet pool and spa area, and the rooms are surprisingly modern with really nice showers and fixtures, cozy bed. Beautiful!! I'd definitely stay there again, and you're in great hands with Brandon as well as the other staff who were very helpful and cheery. The hotel is not at the very rowdy end of Duval Street, but its a short walk if you want to go down there. Its in the more charming and historic area, very close to the Hemingway House, Blue Heaven for great brunch, Nine One Five for great food and wine, La Croissant for great pastries...and 24 hour CVS for beer and other necessities, which was nice. It was an ideal location. Don't hesitate to ask for help getting around and finding things to do - Brandon especially is a fountain of helpful information. Have fun! Also - they have free wifi and nice free breakfast which is great - and a cute bar that will hopefully be open soon. We felt welcome and very well taken care of. Key West was lovely and friendly with a very fun kind of offbeat vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: MelissaByrd
Reviews.Content: This little GEM hotel is amazing. I traveled with my husband on an overnight business trip and we stayed at the Orchid Key Inn, Brandon at the front desk was so very nice, the rooms was very nicely decorated and clean, clean, clean, bed was so comfortable, the grounds and landscaping were impeccable. Location is right on the corner of Truman & Duvall and it was still a very quiet evening sitting out by the pool. This will be our new spot to stay each time we visit the Keys. I strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: bambamohio
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay and it was reasonably priced. I would expect to much more for a room like this, the room seemed like it belonged in a boutique hotel in a big city. Great location on Duval, right on the fringe of everything, but not in the middle of the noise, could easily walk to everything. Great internet access, wired or wireless. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with our stay at Orchid Key Inn”
Reviews.Author: Miami_FlaWaterman
Reviews.Content: All the reviews we read pointed towards a sure thing. They were right. We had no complaints and we were very pleased with the room, the service and the location. We enjoyed breakfast each morning by the pool and happy hour at the nearby sister hotel (Almond Tree Inn). We were, however, rudely interrupted by a Key West rooster who was perched on the tree outside our window. For some reason, the roosters in Key West jump the gun on sunrise by about 3 hours. So I took matters into my own hands each night and chased that rooster out of his tree at 4:00 am. The hotel is located on the relatively quiet end of Duval, so we were not awakened by late night revelers or street noise, just the one rooster.

Reviews.Title: “Orchid Key a true gem”
Reviews.Author: charlie1960
Reviews.Content: Orignally book for one night stopped for two wish it could have been more, great location this hotel has been really tastefully done up, no expence spared in creating lovely rooms. Bar was'nt o[pen during our stay due to licencing issues but that did not spoil the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Orchid Key is the place to be”
Reviews.Author: INDurham
Reviews.Content: We had pretty high expectations for this hotel based on other reviews, the fact that this was our 10 yr anniversary we were celebrating and really didn't want to deal with room hassles this trip. Almost all of our expectations were met by the Orchid Key, Jack, Brandon and the rest of the staff. Location - Personally, I think this was a great location. I've stayed all over the island - the west end of Duval, in some of the neighborhood areas, etc - and I enjoyed this spot the most. It's on Duval, easy walking and biking distance to everything but far enough from the chaos and noise of the west end to be relaxing. Room - on the small side but very clean, very well designed - clearly had been recently renovated and to a high standard with huge shower, recycled glass tile, composite vanity, rich dark woods, modern contemporary fixtures, flat panel HDTV on the wall, safe in the armoire for a laptop and other valuables, small fridge, small microwave, well sound insulated (we faced the pool and could barely tell when people were passing right outside the door), nice bath products, plenty of towels. It was a bit tight but we didn't spend much time in the room. If we had had a lot of luggage and dive gear, it might have been more difficult. Lots of nice well thought design details - like having the shower control near the door so you could get the water going and warm without getting wet. Three small design misses - the spigot on the vanity faucet extends too far over the bowl, add a dimmer to the bathroom lights and there's no ceiling fan, which would be nice to circulate the air without keeping the AC on. (the separate exhaust fan above the toilet and shower area is a plus) Service - terrific - we arrived early and our room was ready, we had a late flight and they accommodated a later check out and then held our bags after that. Great recommendations for restaurants (Jack suggested Michael's which was a hidden local's place for our anniversary dinner), bike rentals, water activities and coupons for a lot of it! Take advantage of their local knowledge. Pool area - big enough for the relatively light number of guest while we were there but I could imagine it could be crowded if the inn is full. Pool is nicely designed with a sun shelf and a small hot tub with waterfall wall. There is no operating bar at this time, so no boat drinks or even a beer while sitting by the pool unless you bring your own - this was a big disappointment. Breakfast/Happy Hour - this was probably the only let down - breakfast was ok - similar to what you find at a Holiday Inn Express, except the HI has hot items. There were bagels, cold cereal, small powdered donuts, muffins, apples, bananas, hard boiled eggs. This could easily be upgraded and make a big difference. The happy hour was the biggest disappointment - see pool/bar comment above - no liquor license yet (how long has the Inn been open? Oct 2008!) They have some decent wines displayed on the non-operational bar wall, but these are not what is offered during happy hour across the street, where happy hour takes place, at the Almond Tree Inn, a sister property. The low-end selections offered didn't fit the otherwise high-end experience of the Orchid Key. There's no excuse for this property not to have an operating bar and to be able to serve drinks poolside - this should be disclosed, since The Orchid Bar is even listed as the 2nd amenity on their own amenity list on their website. Wifi - free, in room, worked great Parking - seemed to be plenty available for a fee - we don't bother with a car while on island so can't comment beyond that it looks to be available. Overall, we will look to stay at the Orchid Key again - thanks Jack, Brandon and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Find!”
Reviews.Author: mikesluckywife
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat, perfect retreat for visit to Key West. Looks like no expenses spared at this Inn - beautiful rooms (a little small probably for some tastes, but who spends a lot of time in the room in Key West?!) Frig, microwave, large flat screen, wifi, terry robes, great bathrooms and rooms are steps from the pool with fabulous loungers. Nice breakfast and Bill, the owner was there most mornings tending over the breakfast and ensuring everyone was taken care of. Happy hour around the corner at sister property Almond Tree Inn until the Orchid Key can serve alcohol (apparently not too much longer). Wine was pretty good - worth the short walk over. And of course I must mention the by now well known Brandon who tends the desk afternoons and evenings - don't stay here without getting recommendations for restaurants and things to do/places to go from him - every hotel should have a Brandon - great attitude, personality and warmth - he gives the Orchid Key that extra something that ensures your return! All in all, a very unique little boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a special treat!”
Reviews.Author: ga_travel_lover
Reviews.Content: My cousins and I went to Key West for one of my cousin's 50th birthday. We stayed at Orchid Key Inn and are so glad we did. It was just a few steps away from the busy part of Duval Street, and close to the Taylor beach, near the lighthouse and Hemingway's house. You never would have known this was once an old hotel. Everything was fresh and new. We enjoyed the hot tub every night after a long day of tennis, the beach and watching the sunsets. A special thanks to Brandon who checked with us each night to ensure we had everything we needed. He recommended several restaurants and every one of them was fantastic. I highly recommend this location for lodging.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful remodel”
Reviews.Author: PK&TK
Reviews.Content: We visited friends who stayed here in early November and were thoroughly impressed with the renovation of what used to be an old trailer court. Beautiful decor, friendly service, great amenities and location. We already booked a stay in February.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly cute and modern boutique hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: advisorbecki
Reviews.Content: I went down to Key West for a night while working in Miami. My gf found this place online, and it turned out to be a great find! The room was pretty big, with the BIGGEST HDTV I've ever seen in a hotel room before - had to be 46" or so!! The color clearly someone who enjoys modern interior decorating had fun with these rooms - loved the blues/greens and the shapes. The shower was large and modern, I was just impressed that it didn't look like an old worn out hotel room. The bar area (below the HDTV mounted on the wall) was large, with a small hidden fridge available that was convenient. Loved the iHome iPod/iPhone dock to recharge my phone. :) The room was cozy - big enough for 2 people for 1 night, but not a place to 'hang out'. The location of the Orchid is awesome - centrally located right on the main drag (I forget the name of the road) but far enough away to not hear all the ruckus from the drunk party-goers. :) We walked everywhere. The hotel had a happy hour with free wine, beer and snacks. The pool was small, but the lounge chairs were awesome - and they provided extra towels - already rolled up on the chaise lounges, waiting to be used. The price was extremely reasonable for how new and renovated/updated everything looked. :)

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: pammob
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at Orchid Key Inn and we WILL be back! The staff was extremely friendly and so helpful and well rounded. Bill, the owner, was on site almost constantly making sure things ran smoothly at all times. All the staff went out of their way to make our stay perfect. This is an old hotel which has recently been redone beautifully and so tastefully. It was the cleanest place I have ever stayed(including my own home)! I would highly recommend staying there and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “The hot tub...wasn't. Otherwise, almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: bornin63
Reviews.Content: Well beyond the noise and craziness, the location couldn't be better as it's at the midpoint of Duval. It was only a short walk to the best bars and restaurants yet we didn't hear anything at night. The room was small but decorated in terrific style. The bed was super comfortable. The bath was a little dark with only two recessed lights but it was well supplied with the thickest towels and a scale! ...just what you want to see when you've been eating and drinking all day. The room was spotless and the entire property was very well maintained. The hot tub was stone cold and the person at the desk didn't seem to care (or believe us) when we complained (not Brandon). It was really disappointing as the nights were cool and a hot tub was an amenity we'd specifically sought out. They later acknowledged there was a problem and that it would be fixed (but not before we left). The free breakfast was terrific and all we needed to start the day. We did think the place was a bit expensive but considering it's brand new hotel (just made to look like the old 50s or 60s hotel it replaced), we didn't feel it was tremendously overpriced. Very tight parking, though - two nasty door dings in 48 hours - beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dagjrorl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 4 days at the Orchid Key over Fantasy Fest. This hotel is in a great location, rooms were clean and very nicely appointed. Pool area was relaxing and even though the hotel is right off Duval it was quiet. Did not take advantage of the breakfast, but looked like a nice offering of items. Price was a little expensive but we were there during an island wide event. Did find that some of the rooms furthest away from the pool, ours included, could not access the wireless internet - had to sit at the pool to have access.

Reviews.Title: “Just one more rave review!”
Reviews.Author: MNmelow
Reviews.Content: Just want to add my continued note to all of the other wonderful reviews of this great hotel. Great location, wonderful staff, very, very, very clean rooms "love it"! The breakfast in the morning was just perfect and the desk staff was more than accomodating. Got a great restaurant tip from Brandon at the front desk and there isn't one bad thing to say about the Orchid Inn. I will reccommend and return. It is a SUPER value for the money!!! And located right on Duval St. made it great for walking, we only moved our car once. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandUKJanice
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at beginning of October, Had been searching for months and couldn't make up my mind where to stay in Key West as there is quite a variety of hotels to choose from. I read the review on Tripadvisor and that made up my mind. We were not disapointed the hotel was modern and spotlessly clean. We had a lovely breakfast int the morning and a happy (two) hours in the sister hotel. Duval St was just around the corner but you were far enough away not to be disturbed. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Lum1234
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Orchid Key Inn was Awesome. The hotel was beautiful and as others have said, the staff was wonderful. We loved the rooms and the bed was the most comfortable thing I have ever slept on. The bathroom was very nice with all of the little details including a scale and full size hair dryer. They also provide nice bathrobes for your use. The pool area was very nice as was the hot tub. There is also a sitting area with a water feature outside about every two rooms. They have a very nice breakfast by the pool every morning that is included and also offer a free happy hour. At the time of our stay, their bar was not open, but we were able to enjoy happy hour and the Almond Tree Inn which was across the street. We would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: audewood
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! My fiance and I came to Key West to get married. I read the reviews on trip advisor and decided to book our room. Everything I read was correct. We absolutely love this hotel. It was clean and quiet and in a perfect location off of Duval. I will say although the hotel was lovely our stay would not have been near as pleasurable without the assistance from hotel staff member Brandon. He was excellent! Everything he recommended was perfect. He went above and beyond to assure our every need was taken care of. He even brought a steamer from home for my wedding dress! Now that is service. We enjoyed meeting Brandon he was a wonderful person and we consider him a friend and look forward to seeing him again on our next visit. If you come to Key west look no further than Orchid Key Inn with Brandon on staff you'll be sure to leave happy and wanting to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Orchid Key”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyBassets
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Key over the Columbus day weekend and could not have been more pleased! The rooms have been recently renovated within the last year, and we found it to be very nice. The bed was really comfortable, and I loved the glass tile that they used in the bathroom, as well as the coconut-lime Bath & Bodyworks products. Breakfast is included every morning, including a selection of breads & pastries, cereals, juices, and coffee. Parking is available for a reasonable daily charge. The location on Duval Street was great for us...around the corner from Hemingway House, walking distance to Mallory Square and Southernmost point, but far enough away from the loud & crazy section of Duval. The only thing that I would mention to someone considering Orchid Key is that the room was on the small side and there was no bathtub (just a really nice, roomy standing shower with a seat). Neither of those bothered us, but could be a negative for other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean & Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: izzwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orchid Key Inn Sept. 28 & 29, 2009. The front desk staff was friendly and accomodating. I needed to plug my camera in to a USB port and they did that for me. Our room was a little small, but completely updated. The bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was beautiful. The pool was clean. The breakfast was good. We liked the free happy hour, too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay We Had A Blast”
Reviews.Author: jcp21
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m going to keep this short because there is so much that other people have said. This place is great and brand new. The rooms are decorated perfect and the bathroom with its large tiled shower was great. My wife liked to call the bed her â€œCloud bedâ€� because it was so soft and comfortable. We need to find out what kind of sheets they use. Brandon is the best; he helped us with every aspect of our trip from the room to food, entertainment and transportation. The man knows his sh?t. Brandon thanks for putting my wife in a great mood. We had a blast allover Key West. Take it from a travel agent this is the place to stay. And if you have any question just ask Brandon.

Reviews.Title: “surreal”
Reviews.Author: surrealIndiana
Reviews.Content: Orchid Key Inn was the best experience we had in Key West !!!!!! We actually stayed 2 more days than planned. The rooms were modern, beautifully decorated and clean. Brandon and Jack were the best hosts. The entire staff was the best you could ask for. I'd like to be selfish and not tell this little secret of Orchid Key Inn but the experience was to great not to share with others. We will definitely be back next time we visit the Keys!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TraBryn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are regular visitors to Key West and of all the different places we've stayed, this one is by far the best. The lobby was elegantly appointed, the spa-like room was tastefully decorated with calming colors and the bathroom amenities had everything you could need. Brandon, who checked us in, was the ulitmate host, even though we were very late coming in and it was almost time for him to go. He treated us as if we were guests in his home, and made sure all our needs were attended and our questions answered before taking his leave for the night. The location of the hotel was also perfect. Close to everything while far enough away from all the noise further down Duval . This small but quaint hotel has everything you could ask for when looking for a place to stay on your visit to Key West, Brandon, we will definately be seeing you again!!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: travelenisfun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an amazing time - thanks to Brandon! We were greeted so nicely after the trip in from Miami (which was delightful as we were a lil' tired from our travels). Brandon told us all the great places to go and was so generous to set us up with many of his connections! We had a wonderful time and will surely go back (wished we could of stayed longer rather than going back and staying a couple of planned days in Miami)!! Great location (in the middle of it all, everything is walking distance), very clean and absolutely updated and beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be a nicer hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smokeyallstars
Reviews.Content: When you first arrive,the beauty of the grounds instantly relaxes your sense of sight. Then when you enter the perfectly clean room,your sense of smell kicks in. (what do they use to clean? So nice!) How wonderful to arrive to a place that has a complimentary happy hour! That is when your sense of taste kicks in. (yummy snacks along with beer ,wine or soda) Last but certainly not least,the bed after a long fun filled day. Ahhhhhhhh!! All the staff rocks. Very helpful. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - an amazing delight!”
Reviews.Author: GippyP
Reviews.Content: We had never been to the Keys before, and based on the reviews posted here, we decided on the Orchid Key Inn. They have recently gone thru a multi-million dollar remodel and it was utterly amazing. We were put into the room that is directly on Duval Street and I was concerned about being kept up at night with the entertainment that occurs on Duval. I was stunned that the room was practically sound-proof. Brandon was more that a delight to deal with. ALL of his recommendations were spot-on from restaurant choices to fun things to do. He is warm, engaging, kind and authentic. There is no doubt that this is the only B&B that we will consider when returning this year.

Reviews.Title: “Simply magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: MMOBNJ
Reviews.Content: To say that the Orchid Key was our best lodging experience would be an understatement. The room and grounds were immaculate and the location was perfect. Brandon was a magnificent host, as were the rest of the staff. Key West is our favorite getaway and we have now truly found a home away from home when we visit. Marty and Mara, Old Bridge, NJ

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and pool, great service. I'll stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jodibrianna
Reviews.Content: The Orchid Key is in a great spot. It's on Duval, easy to find, and within walking distance of pretty much everything you'd want to do. The rooms were very clean and well decorated. The bed was super comfortable! The pool is lush and inviting. My friend and I spent hours there. The staff was supremely helpful, especially Brian. He made reservations for us for outings and made sure we had discounts at most of the places we visited. Breakfast and happy hour were a nice bonus. I'll absolutely stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Orchid Key Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1004 Duval Street, Key West, FL 33040
